Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ebrada
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the hotel, the room was very clean and super nice! Nice decor, comfy king size bed! The bathroom was huge, just as big as the room itself.Loved it!! It was perfect location for the bal en blanc party that we were attending which was right across the street! Highly recommend this hotel if you ever attend future Bal en Blanc party's. The hotel was quiet, not too many people and the service was great! Access to the subway is connected to the hotel so there is no need to even go outside. Hotel was a great location and I look forward to staying here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grahamrobertson
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for years. Rooms are well kept. Location for those looking to explore Old Montreal, this is perfect. Out the back door and you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTartar
Reviews.Content: As top hotels go, this one is acceptable. It's getting a little old. The bathroom floors were cold. The view from our room was obstructed and breakfast was frankly quite so so. The staff were, however, very nice and the valet parking was prompt. As for the $7 complimentary water bottle on the desk, that's a little steep. One good note was the internet + unlimited international phone calls for $15 a day. Next time I'm in Montreal I'll probably try an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with lots of nice touches”
Reviews.Author: orange-hats
Reviews.Content: We bought a package deal for one night at the InterContinental. It's a great location close to Old Montreal and downtown, easy to walk everywhere and attached to the underground. We got a corner room on the 18th floor which is quite nice. Our room was a nice size with all the amenities needed. There were no robes in the room when we arrived but they were very quickly delivered when I called to ask for them. Everyone in the hotel is very nice, always friendly and helpful regardless of who you are dealing with. They accomodated our request for early check in even though the hotel was full. Our package included access to the "club" which is really great. The host in the club was very helpful! We went there for a sort of Happy hour at 5:30 and they had out a nice display of hors d'oeuvres and many choices of wine and other drinks (no charge!). There was smoked salmon, pasta, cheese, veggies, etc, a very nice assortment We could have just stayed there and eaten enough for our dinner! But we went to Osco for dinner. Dinner at Osco was very good, a nice restaurant, Our server seemed distracted and forgot about us for most of the evening, but we sensed this was more of a one time thing. We still enjoyed dinner. Prices were reasonable and our package included a $25 discount. When we got back to our room, they had come by and left a little package with mini-cupcakes, a bottle of water and a personalized note. Nice touch and the cupcakes were really delicious! A personalized note accompanied this little gift. We enjoyed our stay at the InterContinental and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “My second home”
Reviews.Author: LBoutin
Reviews.Content: Even before I enrolled in the Priority club (free membership) , I felt very good and welcome every-time I was arriving at the location . The staff are very professional and polite. The location of the hotel couldn't be more perfect, you can arrive via train (10$ taxi to go to the hotel), then you use the subway to travel anywhere you want in Montreal, ( you have the subway connecting underneath of the building next door). The room are sparkling clean every-time , huge windows, a nice sight of the town in every room ; and when you are a Priority Member, you get so many perks that you believe that you are royalty ( a real Ambassador) room upgrade (like on the top floor of the hotel, amazing suites, just to name that one!!) whenever I am going to Montreal, I just tell every one that I am going to my second home!

Reviews.Title: “I â™¥ The InterContinental Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JSLPCrew
Reviews.Content: We've just returning from our three night stay at the interContinental Montreal. We decided to plan our trip around a concert, birthday and anniversary. I love investigating hotels and spent some time searching the hotel websites looking for good deals back in January. I came across the Intercontinental Montreal and we booked the Deluxe Irresistible Room. Apon arrival at the hotel, we were treated to the attractive reception area and check-in. The front desk was polite and there was no wait. Once we had received our room keys, we ascended to the 23rd floor to our room. Upon entree I realized we were given a room with two double beds rather then one king. I called reception and they said they had two other rooms with kings but they were on the 10th and 14th floors and had less attractive views but if we would like, we could move. The view from our room on the 23rd floor was wonderful, overlooking the St. Laurence river, facing l'il bizarre and the port. We decided to stay. The room was spotless with a contemporary decor, a large flat screen tv, mini bar, desk, chair, iPod dock, regular hotel literature, two pillow top double beds and a comfy chair with foot rest. The bathroom was a comfortable size with triangular shower, separate bath, toilet and deep sink. Basic toiletries were provided. The first night when my fiancÃ©e attended a concert with friends, I spoke to the front desk if they could assist me in organizing some spa activities. In a matter of minutes, the front desk had arranged an appointment at an Old Montreal salon followed by a massage with one of the hotel's RMTs. While my fiancÃ©e attended a concert, I was pampered at the salon and received a skilled deep tissue massage by one of the hotel's RMTs in their health spa. At this point you could go for a swim in the pool, but I was too relaxed and returned to my room. Following my appointments, I ordered room service which was from Osco's, the hotel's restaurant. I called using the direct line. They answered immediately addressing me using my name (nice touch). Nothing ever seemed like a bother for the staff. They are all so authentically pleasant, it really made me feel special - as if I was the only guest there. The room service was delivered within 20 minutes with a lovely additional touch - miniature cupcakes from the chef. So cute and yummy too! The remaining nights we visited the Sarah B. Bar and ordered room service once more from Osco's. Sara B. Bar's specialty is Absinthe. We each tried it for the first time and enjoyed as the bartender introduced us to its process of dripping cold water over a sugar cube from a beautiful art nouveau styled water fountain. Overall I absolutely love this hotel and feel I was truly treated to an exceptional experience. The hotel is so quite for sleeping, beautifully decorated, the staff are top-notch. Each day the room was straightened by housekeeping making it a wonderful retreat from our daily and nightly adventures. The location of the hotel is fantastic as well. You have an assortment of mid-priced to fine dining restaurants in close proximity. The historic streets of old Montreal, the awe inspiring cathedral of Notre Dame and the port are all only short walks away. In each direction you turn, you will be presented with the old world architecture of the city, juxtaposed with contemporary buildings - the area is a real treat for the senses. Would I stay at the Intercontinental Montreal again. Bien sur! In a heart beat! Thank you IM for a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you get it for a good price, then it's alright”
Reviews.Author: QC_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two seperate nights in February, got the rooms for $100/night through a special "zoo" promotion. At this price, we cannot complain a lot. The location is great, just between Old Montreal and Downtown. WINTER TIP : It is connected to the underground city, so you can get all over downtown without going outside. Just go down and grab a map, you can get to your destination without having your ears fall off, even on the coldest day! The rooms leave something to be desired for decor, they seem dated with burgundy reds. The bed is comfortable enough to sleep on, the "view" of the deluxe room is nothing special, you can see the port if you look way to the side...other than that you are facing another high rise unless you get very high in the building. The bathroom seems the most dated of all, the bathtub is not deep enough for a relaxing soak, and the shower is small and feels crammed. On the 2nd night, we found out in the morning that our shower drain was virtually blocked so we couldn't take a shower. I mentioned it on checkout and the clerk just said "OK" without apologizing or recognizing that it was an actual problem. I had to mention it again to ensure she actually noted it for the maintenance people at the very least. The concierge was very nice, we appreciated her assistance.She didn't seem to know the area as well as one would expect, but she did put in a great effort to help us find places we were specifically looking for. If this hotel were not connected to the underground city, and if I had paid more than $100 I would certainly be removing a star here. Those two things will allow me to give a 4 star rating. Next time I will pay a few extra $$ to try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: P G
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is very nice and staff are friendly. Our room was a decent size, comfortable and clean. It is not overly luxurious but still very nice. The bed was a little uncomfortable which was the only downside to the bed. On our second night, we discovered that we were missing a coffee maker in the room. So I called and they said they would send someone up - it was about 11:00 at night, and the gentleman that came with the coffee maker said he had to install it, he couldn't just leave it with us. So then there was some guy in our room for about 10 minutes putting in the coffee maker which I thought was a little odd and unfortunate that they didn't check the room first. Wireless internet costs an extra $15 per night. When you book the room, I would ask for the i-connect package. You can't get it at check in, but if you get it ahead of time, it is $11 a night for wireless internet plus unlimited phone calls - a much better deal. We went to the restaurant downstairs for buffet breakfast. Definitely NOT worth it. It was a weekday (not sure if it is better on weekends), but it was $23 per person and the food was not very good, and I would have thought there would be more variety for $23. The chef who was supposed to make eggs and omelettes for you was often on a smoke break which is not helpful when you are in a rush for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Torontobeacher123
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for old Montreal and waterfront. Breakfast buffet was good with excellent service . No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “We are booking again, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Holakat
Reviews.Content: It has been a very long time since I have been to Montreal. What a nice welcome to come back too. The staff at this hotel were amazing, truly amazing! Friendly and welcoming. We enjoyed the food, the service, the lounge, concierge service, rooms - not a bad word to say about anything. Kudos to all of you and we will return as soon as we can! Besides the fact that everything was great this a wonderful location because you can walk easily enough throughout Old Montreal, easy to get to if you are taking the Metro, get out at Square Victoria and it is a short walk underground right into the hotel....very nice on a minus 25 degree day!

Reviews.Title: “Good and could use a few improvements”
Reviews.Author: Whiseboy
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was excellent, the staff was friendly. I can't say enough by the concierge Jamil, he was extremely friendly and knew exactly where to send us to meet our needs. He even texted his few friends to get us VIP treatment at one of the clubs in Old Montreal. His knowledge of the city was excellent and his great suggestions were greatly appreciated by my wife and I. There were a few downsides about this hotel the first being that the internet isn't free, it's $15 a day. They offer wifi in the lounge but for a five star hotel you would assume that wifi should be free in the comfort of your room. The rooms were very comfortable, large and well decorated. The bathrooms are nice and very large, our shower was a bit weathered, noticeable amounts of mold in between the grout lines, also some dried up caulking that was breaking apart from the side marble pieces. Our bathroom could have used a bit of updating to meet other five star hotels we've stayed at in the past. The continental breakfast had plenty of variety and the food was great. Another down side was the parking, we ended up parking at the garage under the hotel which is very expensive $23 a day. The hotel is walking distance to Old Montreal and the great restaurants. Needless to say I would probably stay here again if the opportunity presented itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jterakita
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Montreal Tourism's Sweet Deals packages (1/2price off 2nd night). Great location. Literally a 5 minute walk from Old Montreal and the Port. The hotel was situated ontop of the underground "city" so you don't have to walk outside, which is much needed during Montreal winters. Connected to the metro as well which was nice. Room: We stayed in the 1King Intimate Standard. Bed was extremely comfortable, tv flat screen, iPod dock/radio, washroom was big enough, pretty standard, and the stand in shower and separate tub is always nice! Toiletries were amazing and replenished. Towels clean and plentiful. *Ask for a room with a nice view when reserving. Some rooms look out to a brick wall. We had a great view of Mount-Royal and the downtown core. Sarah B Absinthe Bar- in the lobby was busy on Friday night from 5-7pm. Absinthe served with proper water spouts and was tasty. ($15/drink) Rest of the drinks ranged from $9-20ish. Cons: We did not touch the mini bar in our room and upon check out were charged for a drink (make sure they know you did not take anything as it is all "automated") Also, they charged us for Dry Cleaning and Laundry and did not say anything. After handing me the receipts I noticed and asked about the charge. Apparently they had charged us instead of the guest from the previous stay. Were not very apologetic. Just double check your totals upon check out. Also, our side mirror in our room was broken and the end bench at the foot of the bed was dirty with coffee (obviously they did not clean it) However the mirror was fixed right away which was nice! Parking- $65 for the 2 nights to park 9levels down and must take 2 elevators and cross the parking lot just to get to the lobby is a bit ridiculous. Valet parking 32/day, took up first 8levels. a bit convoluted for a 5 star hotel. BUT overall the location was great, people friendly, concierge helpful, check in quick, room nice, great weekend in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, great Club Access”
Reviews.Author: SarahMarguerite
Reviews.Content: Went here with my husband for a one-night getaway over Family Day weekend. We booked through hotwire.com and got a great rate. I called the hotel itself and added club access for an added fee. I highly recommend doing this, because it includes, canapes (hot and cold) at 5:30pm-7:30pm with unlimited drinks, buffet breakfast for two, club access 24hours a day, a newspaper in the morning and a few other goodies. This made our time together very special and the club was not very busy. The man who runs the club is amazing, he is so friendly! In the club there is a huge flatscreen tv with movie channels, and board games for a nice night in. The location of this hotel is amazing if you want to take in the sights in Old Montreal. It is a 10 minute walk to Olive and Gourmando, an AMAZING cafe and sandwhich shop which is always busy! The room was nice, not very big, but ok. There was a king size bed, a lounge chair, a desk and chair, a flatscreen TV, a closet. The bathroom had a corner shower and a seperate bath. I have to say....the bathroom wasn't impressive. A little dated. It looked like the room had been renovated but they didnt do the bathroom. The bathroom amenities were amazing. Actually, the best hotel shampoo and conditioner I've ever used! All L'Occitane, all amazing. The service at this hotel was very good. Our room keys stopped working a couple of times, but they were quick to fix them. Also, watch out if you are checking out late. A housekeeper came into our room in the morning, which was a little unsettling. We had forgot to call for a late checkout... The bed was very comfortable, I slept better than at home. The pool was nice, but it is a lap pool, so you have to staya moving! There is a sauna in the womens lockeroom, which was very nice. The gym is nice too. Overall, it was an amazing night at this hotel, and we would definately return! Club access is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff/Location/Club Lounge - Facility Average”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: Good -Location - Great location w/ 5 min walk to the edge of Old Montreal. 30 min walk up town for shopping. Easy Valet parking @ $32 night -Club - Although told the Club open 24/7 it is closed on Sunday so given 2 free breakfast buffet tickets in the Osco restaurant which is "much" better for Brkfst. Excellent free wine/beer/alcohol 530-7pm is a highlight. You can buy Club access for $30 per person from the Concierge if not in a Club room or not staying at the hotel ie meetings. -Sarah B's - Fun Absinthe Bar on site Bad -Checked into a 1/2 dirty room that had to be redone. Management handled staff layoffs poorly. 50% cuts found rooms dirty, common areas/elevators often filthy all day. Club staff cut from 2 to 1. Service issues/negative vibe from over worked staff. Expecting staff shortages into April they said. -Poor recognition for top tier IC Royal Ambassador member -Don't expect a prompt email reply. Call in person for any requests. Waited 1 week for a reply and never got a reply at all on a 2nd email.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: GA072010
Reviews.Content: A group of four of stayed at the hotel during Thanksgiving Holiday weekend. The receptionists did everything possible to make our stay pleasant, even changed our rooms to bigger without any additional charges. We are very happy with our stay at the InterContinental. The only thing that is missing at the hotel is free Wi-Fi. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet deals and amazing hotel!! Very special!!”
Reviews.Author: LAURAandGLENN
Reviews.Content: Hotel suite was incredibly beautiful and the club was included. Our room was very very roomy and luxurious. All the staff at hotel were gracious kind & extremely helpful. The evening concerige on weekend was a huge help!!! The club is great!! Definitely worth the extra yo get room with club included. The club includes breakfast daily, free liquor beer & wine drinks & appetizers in the evening. You get unlimited non alcoholic drinks & coffee thru out day.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred this much more than the last hotel in Old Montreal I stayed at”
Reviews.Author: clamc40
Reviews.Content: This was another work trip - the first one was May/2011 and we stayed at the nearby Hotel St. Paul. This latest work trip - Jan/2012 - we stayed at the Intercontinental and I preferred it much more. Although this was a work trip (and therefore, I wasn't looking for the same time of things as I would have had it been personal/leisure/vacation), I could see myself staying here on a leisure basis if I had to be in the area. A very good location - handy to all the character and atmosphere of Old Montreal. The decor was pleasing to the eye, and I found the front desk service quite good. Sleeping was comfortable, the room and bathroom was clean and large, and the internet worked. The hotel-provided catering for our meetings was good, and service was professional. Check-in and out was smooth and quick, and taxi service to the door was also quick and efficient. As we would have received a group rate, I won't comment specifically on the value, but although I very much dislike being away from home for work, I was satisfied with this facility for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Too Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: Without question this hotel is very nice. It is well located for Old Montreal, Palais de Congres, the subway lines, St. Catherines Street and other sites (but not for Montreal Canadiens hockey games nor for a wide variety of restaurants). The staff can be very helpful although the door staff were stumped about what to do with the cargo van I drove to Montreal to retrieve my daughter's college furniture. My room was clean and quiet with a nice view but for the price of the stay the room should have been bigger and better. There are far more interesting hotels in Montreal for the same price, especially the boutique hotels in Old Montreal. The hotel is large enough to hold a conference but if you are looking for a romantic getaway or something a little more trendy, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel - short walk to Old Montreal & Cafes/Rests.”
Reviews.Author: tonydowntownnyc
Reviews.Content: This is a nice modern hotel on the edge of the Old City - just a couple of blocks into the heart of the old cobblestone street district with it's cafes and restaurants. Hotel has great picture windows with views of the city. It is in walking distance to many attractions. Hotel is modern, although decor harks back about a decade. Large bathroom, comfortable beds with good linens. Good Value, compared with other hotels in the Old City.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: Kip73
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose to stay here on the referral of a friend and because of it's central location to downtown and Old Montreal. The staff was friendly and very helpful in regards to directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. The decor is up to date and modern, quite swank. There is a bar and a restaurant, of which we only experienced the bar. Good munchies with your drinks, ask for absinthe and water if you've never tried it (interesting and tasty). Our only complaint with the bar was that the service wasn't great. The hotel has either 4 or 6 elevators, I can't remember, but we never had to wait long for one. A nice touch was that during the day there were mats in the elevators that read "Bonjour" and in the evening they were switched out to "Bonsoir". We had a king room on the 19th floor with a view of the next building. Wasn't impressed as we'd asked for a room with a view, but we didn't complain as our intent wasn't to stare out the window for 4 days. Given that the hotel is in the financial district, most views may quite be similar to the one we had. Our room was spacious, modern and very clean. The bed and bedding was divine and we slept deep and long every night. We didn't hear a sound from neighbouring rooms or the hallway. My boyfriend's only complaint was that the room wasn't bright enough. There was a Keurig coffee machine that was restocked daily with Colombian coffee and green tea. The washroom was also spacious, had a great showerhead with good pressure, large towels, a salon style hairdryer and a decent fan. Old Montreal is a few blocks away in one direction and the downtown core is a few more blocks away in the other direction. We walked everywhere. Cab fare from the airport was $38. All in all, this was a good stay and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for the price”
Reviews.Author: GyspySoles
Reviews.Content: Booked this on a great deal with TravelZoo. Although there was some confusion with the booking upon arrival, got that sorted out and checked into our room. Modern, clean, fairly spacious and well appointed. Comfy chair, nice tv etc. Towels, robe and linens all good quality. Really comfortable bed and greatest pillows ever! Very nice little treat of bottled water and macarons left in room during evening. Nice touch indeed! Had (overpriced!) drinks in the lobby bar - a draft beer and caesar $21+ with taxes. Buffet breakfast was included in our "sejour" and was pretty decent with a good selection of baked goods, breakfast meats, eggs, fruits, yogurts, cheese, etc. Although it was good, I doubt I'd go back if I had to pay regular price (23$ per person). Only thing that I thought a bit chintzy was charging 10$ for 2 hours internet. Come on people, its 2012 - you get free internet at airports and most hotels. Why not throw it in? Other than that, very pleased with the Intercontinental and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: popoldc
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about the staff - including concierge - I've staid there for about 8 nights and as frequent traveller i was impressed by the friendlyness of the reception desk staff - bar man and for sure the concierge who did his utmost to accomodate my stay - ... unfortunately not all downtown of montreal is safe and you should NOT leave anything unattended in any circumstances and for sure not in cars !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: c_leigh22
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for 2 nights in the Â«IconicÂ» Tourelle Suite. It was an amazing experience! The room decor was modern and inviting. There was a 40" plasma TV in both the bedroom and living room. An automated bar in the bedroom (a word of warning, don't move around the beverages as the automated system keeps track and can accidentally be charged to your bill!) The suites grant you access to the Club room on the main floor, which has a wonderful happy hour each day with complimentary food and drinks (including beer, wine, and spirits). The staff were all incredibly knowledgable and polite, both in English and French, and all services were prompt and thorough. Delicious restaurant and wonderful absynthe bar in the lobby. From the bedsheets to the bath soaps this hotel was 1st class without being pretentious. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy rooms, great location, fine staff.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in January 2011. Pros: Rooms are very-well equipped with large Samsung 40" plasmas, a comfortable lounge chair with ottoman, minibar and proper drinking glasses. Super-comfortable beds and a diverse selection of pillows. Soundproofing between rooms was excellent, I never heard anything. Curtains blackened the room very effectively. Contemporary designs with a soothing palate proliferate from the bright lobby right through to the pleasing in-room decor. Quality toiletries and fine shower pressure with instant hot water. Efficient ice machine. Elevators were always ready and open in the lobby. Close to the VIA central train station and Old Montreal with a vast assortment of shops and restaurants nearby. Cons: Work desk area lacks a practical desk chair that rotates and reclines. TV remote was odd, as each and every time one turned on the TV, one was met with a black screen in a strange input mode. One needs to press a channel e.g. "002" and wait several seconds to get any signal. I am sure this has confused many. Heat worked very well and operated at a low hum. In some cases, form overrides function, such as the work desk lamp in the far corner which only activates by the door entry switch 25 feet away, or the mirror above the desk set at a height nowhere near that of an adult. Overall, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel is situated in a great location right on a Subway station, close to old montreal and the trendier parts. I found the staff very friendly just HELLO 21th century wireless internet should be standard and FREE. there is a computer lounge in the hotel but with only 1 computer for use. Also, the room's furnishings were average a little dated for a 5 star hotel as advertised outside on the building.

Reviews.Title: “our favourite hotel when on business trip to montreal”
Reviews.Author: Nadia D
Reviews.Content: our favourite hotel when on business trip to montreal. rooms have all necessarity amenities, and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: NLCook
Reviews.Content: A friend and I came to Montreal for the weekend to eat out in Old Montreal and shop on St. Catherine. We found this hotel to be the perfect location to walk to both areas. The lobby was very contemporary and although we didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, it looked very nice. We arrived around 12:30p.m. and were given our room without any issues. It was on the 21st floor with a fabulous view of downtown Montreal. The room itself was very spacious, clean and well appointed. Our only complaint is that we were woken up at 4 a.m. by music and singing in the room next to us. We called the front desk who immediately resolved the issue. The beds were also very comfortable! For someone who wants to be within easy walking distance to both downtown shopping and Old Montreal, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Experience”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: I was attending the Montrela Auto Show at the the Palais de Congress across the street (or via the underground) and was referred to the InterContinental Montreal. This is a wonderful downtown hotel that offers all the features and uniqueness of a boutique hotel, without the excessive price. It is only a 10-15 minute walk from Montreal Central Train Station with enough window shopping and restaurants to see along the way. And you are just a short walk from Catherine street and all the shops and sites it has to offer, too. My room was geneerously large with a very comfortable bed, big screen TV, a stereo to dock my iPod and great inroom coffee. The bathroom was also large, well finished with both a tub or a separate shower stall with a nice marble decor. The room is very quiet as the hallways are; both are very clean, fresh and comfortable. When booking, i went to their website and then chatted online to get hotel information and ultimately book my room (you can also do this strictly on line, but the cusotmer service person was so nice to "chat" with. A very, very positive experience. The great cusotmer service continued for my whole visit for reception and check out as well as the bar and restaurant inbetween. Great service, good food. Awesome! Yes, a downtown hotel is pricey, but relative to others in Montreal, this is more than worth the price. Yes, i highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “great staff, great location but...”
Reviews.Author: Restinnature
Reviews.Content: smelly, stinky blankets! the white sheets are fine but the dark colored blankets that is folded at the foot of the bed seems like it had been through several customers, Yuck! we didn't use it but we can smell it in our sleep so we tuck it away in the closet. we had breakfast buffet downstairs at osco's, food was good and the staff were friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the InterContinental Montreal!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dillydallying
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental for three nights over New Years and had a wonderful time. Check in was smooth, with an early check-in absolutely no problem. We (two adults and one child) were given complimentary coupons for the breakfast buffet for each morning of our stay at the hotel's restaurant Osco; which was a welcomed added perk. Our room was a double room with a view looking out onto the Convention Centre and Park in front of the hotel. Wonderful city view! It is worth the small charge to upgrade to a room with a view. The room was spotless, the bathroom is fantastic, with a tub and shower separate and a good size, the beds were very comfortable and the room felt spacious and contemporary. The hotel has very nice public spaces with a dark and sexy vibe with Art Deco furnishings and accoutrements. Osco, the restaurant, was beautiful and the buffet breakfast was above-average; everything fresh and tasty. My son, who is a picky eater, found many selections which he enjoyed. The staff; front desk, valet parking, bell staff, restaurant, pool & work-out facility, were all very gracious and helpful. The pool on the 10th floor was a nice added touch in an Old Montreal Hotel, which my son and I used everyday. It was extremely clean. It is a four-and-a-half foot deep rectangular lap pool, which adults and children were both using and enjoying. They provide kick boards and life vests for anyone with really little ones. We found the location of the InterContinental to be perfect; in Vieux (Old) Montreal. We walked to dinner every night; down to rue St-Paul, with numerous restaurants to choose from. Notre-Dame Basilica; the breath-taking Catholic church was a leisurely five minute walk away (bring your camera) and the Centre des Sciences de Montreal is also within walking distance down to the Old Port. The science centre is worth checking out, as is the Biodome de Montreal (a short drive away). If you have a CAA card, you will save on the admission for both these attractions. We would definitely stay at the InterContinental Montreal again and will remember our trip fondly.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: businessgirl_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. The decor is amazing! The flow from the entrance, up the escalators to the lobby and front desk, and then to the elevators is well designed. The beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are nice and quiet. I also liked that the hotel was adjoined to the building beside it, so you could take an indoor path when the weather isn't pleasant. The only bad thing I have to say about this hotel, is the wait for an elevator. When it's busy, you could be waiting a while.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: SampaJames
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this establishment. The room I stayed at was big, clean, and beautiful (the view was not so great, towards some other apartments, but I didn't care much). It is located right by the main streets, restaurants, and touristic points.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: granteth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location but is a bit on the older side. We arrrived and our room was not ready but they promised to upgrade us to a corner suite (which they did and it was awesome). The service was prompt and kind. The room was awesome and had a large comfortable bed. The view from my room was awesome and I would take that room again in a heartbeat (2100). The hotel bar was nice and lively. Overall, enjoyed the stay. Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Texasdomer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and afforded us a nice walk around cultural Montreal. The room was decent size with a large comfortable bed. The view from my room was awful so make sure you request a better view if that means anything to you. Hotel staff seemed very friendly and we had not problems. The hotel bar was nice and lively. Overall, enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal service. I won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Cdngirl_68
Reviews.Content: Iv'e stayed at the Intercontinental at least 15 times and each time I honestly wonder why I go back. This time, my office had made a reservation for me using our corporate credit card (my wallet had been stolen) and was assured that there would be no problem for me when I arrived to check in late that night. However, this was not the case. Not only would they not honour the card used, I had to pay cash upfront for the room and also a $150 damage deposit. Then I was told someone would need to check my room before I left in the morning. Wow. Unbelievable treatment. I appreciate credit card fraud issues but I also think, as an executive who works for a very reputable firm, that this is a bit much. As I told them, I will not be back. That was the final straw. And, I should note I've always voiced my concerns directly to the front desk staff, written other reviews, and no one seems to care. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous bed”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in the Old Port of Montreal. It is superbly decorated, staff are very nice, the bathroom is huge and very nice. But what I'll remember the most will be how comfortable the bed was; the sheets and pillows were top notch. A must if you go in that area!

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPRESSED!”
Reviews.Author: Rob R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here and I found the hotel to be pretty sub-standard for the 4.5 star rating. The pool was very dirty and there was hair floating everywhere - it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. Considering the pool closes at 7:30PM, this should leave lots of time to clean it. I was also accused of connecting the internet in my room at check-out - which boggles me to this day since it had never been used over the course of my stay! Apparently all you need is a last name and room number to gain access to internet, so I'm guessing someone hacked me. Very secure system Intercontinental! Although the location was great, the lack of good service and cleanliness guarantees I will never return to this hotel, especially since I expect more when I pay for 4-5 stars. Lots of other hotels in the area - stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Classy, Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: AndreaD068
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here - great location in Old Montreal, beautiful decor, room was so nicely decorated - and clean, clean, clean. I could not find a spec of dirt in the bathroom. Nice marble shower with good water pressure. Nice fresh duvet cover over duvet on comfy bed with lots of pillows. Large flatscreen, bar fridge, Kuerig coffee machine. We stay in alot of hotels and I was really impressed with the decor and cleanliness. Breakfast buffet/a la carte was the usual ridiculous hotel pricing, but it beat staggering around in a blizzard finding a breakfast spot. The buffet was 'okay'. Coffee- delicious. I would stay here again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location and value”
Reviews.Author: 12144Henry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights last week and was amazed at the quality and location especially at the price we paid. I paid only $80 per night booking through Priceline. I know that November in Montreal is off season, but I was still amazed. Clean and spacious rooms, and within walking distance to old town and many of the top sights and best restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a nice stay but with a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: Maisy_AB
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a long weekend stay at the Intercontinental Montreal. It was booked through Priceline. During the booking process, we specified that our party consisted of 2 adults and 2 children. Apparently, all rooms booked through Priceline get a king bed standard but you can have the option of upgrading to 2 beds (for an additional $20/night) or king with pull-out (for an additional $30/night). Not sure why these options werenâ€™t stated on Priceline, and why bother having a â€˜dealâ€™ when you are obligated to upgrade anyway. As other posters have stated, internet was $14/day. We have stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels where the internet was included and complimentary bottled water was available daily. Better to increase the rate and include these incidentals rather than drop the rate and nickel/dime everything. During check-in, I arrived earlier than my husband. Because my name was not on the reservation, I had to call my husband to have him add my name on. I understand and appreciate that this is a security issue. So I waited with my 2 young children while this was being sorted out. The front-desk clerk provided a number for my husband to call and he was on the phone for nearly 15 minutes while they were scrambling to find just the right contact person to deal with this situation. This was unfortunate and shouldâ€™ve been handled better. As an aside, my husband was on a train from Toronto and could easily been out of reach to even phone in. If that was the case, I would've been sitting in the lobby with 2 kids for 5 more hours. A little resourcefulness or other solutions would've been better than to simply say "feel free to wait in the lobby". On our second night at the hotel, our neighbours were having a loud party at 3:30AM. Two calls were made to the front desk and things quieted down after an hour. No apologies or follow-up after that incident. We dined in Osco (the hotel restaurant). The food was pricey but good. There is no childrenâ€™s menu but they made a pasta dish for $8. The various staff who managed the concierge desk was very knowledgeable. Room was very nice. Beds were comfortable. We had a beautiful view. Location of hotel was excellent. Pool was nice but small. Tip: Iâ€™ve noticed that for some of these comments, management has a post as wellâ€¦ sometimes with thanks and other times with an apology. If that happens here, an apology for the check-in delays and disrupted sleep would have been better done in person than online. Always best to mitigate hard feelings beforehand so it doesn't result in negative feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Reliable. But not so sure about the fake animal fur in the lobby ...”
Reviews.Author: J-J-9917
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011. Very nice. Room fairly clean. This was an older hotel which was obviously renovated at some point. Would stay here again. Convenient, as there was an onsite restaurant as well as a breakfast fast food in the connected shopping centre. But what is with the fake animal fur in the lobby (wall by escalator) ... I know we are Canadians ... but really ... fake beaver fur on the wall? Fake animal prints on the lobby furniture? Glad to see the fur was fake ... but not so sure the designer was worth the money they paid ...

Reviews.Title: “Worth every star”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: I booked the InterContinental Montreal on HotWire where it was advertised as a 4 1/2 star hotel. The staff was very accommodating and professional and service was quick and delivered with a smile. When we had a problem with the heat in our room a technician was at our door in 5 minutes and fixed the problem promptly and courteously. The location is perfect for exploring the various attractions of Old Montreal and the area is safe and attractive. I would not hesitate to stay at the InterContinental Montreal again and to recommend it to anyone staying in the downtown Montreal area.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: hanmuli
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite here for a gathering at a convention. The staff could not have been more helpful. They loaned us trays and bowls and helped cart in things from the garage. The suite was perfect for a meeting or gathering -- stunning views, separate bedroom and large bathroom. I am very glad we booked here.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: mcoelho7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental Montreal last year. Great location. Staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast every morning is just amazing!! Will go back at any time. Walking distance to the old town and near the Metro, just besides the convention centre. The bedroom was spacious and with great view of the plaza and convention centre, especially at night....smoking and lights from the waterfall just added to the good vibe!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: LiserT
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the InterContinental Montreal. The property was right between Downtown Montreal and Old Montreal, so it's in the perfect place if you have a limited amount of time to see the city. There is also a metro stop right across the street, so that's very handy. I had a standard king size room, which was lovely. The view could have been better as I was just looking into the windows of another hotel, but that was really my biggest problem with the hotel, so that's pretty good! The lobby is lovely and very well decorated. The hotel bar is pricey, so if you're on a bit of a budget, steer clear. For a single gin and tonic it cost me over $10! There is a lovely (slightly overpriced) cafe in the hotel that is great for getting breakfast and small snacks. There is also a Mac's convenience store about a 3 minute walk away that's good for getting beer and other hotel treats.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: matt198816
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in November. We booked through priceline, and got a price of 85 USD per night, well below the price on the website. Check in was smooth, we were offered help with our luggage but with a light suitcase each was not needed. The room was excellent, not a great view from our room but was expected with our price. We did not use any of the faclities, as it was a quick trip. Even though check out was at noon, we were able to store our luggage until our 6 pm flight, which was great. If you can get a good price, go for this hotel. Close to a metro station, we had a 3 day pass which got us an express bus to and from the airport and made all of our planned destinations very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joeybella
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. I was surprised by some of the negative comments posted. The hotel is lovely, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was very kind and helpful. It was also a great location you could walk to old town or take the metro (which is located across the street) to st. catherine's street or anywhere else. If you're looking for a loud party atmosphere I would reccommend that you get a hotel closer to peel street. The area where the hotel is located is very quiet at night, but I didnt mind it at all. If I could find a good deal like I did on this trip I would definately stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient, comfie”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: My stay was amazing. I saw the pictures on the internet, but the room was just beautiful and cozy; things you don't normally find together on a business trip. The lobby had a moadern feel of a twist on past times. Gerry at concierge was just amazing, helpful,chatty! Could tell he loved his job. Made some great recommendations and also gave me a little bit of Montreal history. Ate in the restaurant downstairs-food was great but service could've been a tad faster. I would suggest getting the Club Lounge package. Great food, very rewarding. One attendant might come off a bit snobbish though (only one we came across in the hotel). Beds were extrememly comfie and pillows were nice and plush. I would stay again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: johancanada
Reviews.Content: Very neat and clean. Staff very friendly and bilingual. Quiet rooms. Enjoyed the bar and meals available there.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: joanoArmagh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at the Intercontinental and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff,service, food, facilities and location were fantastic. We were upgraded to a deluxe room with the most wonderful view over the city. The room was spacious, very clean and comfortable. We particularly enjoyed the comfortable bed. The standard of housekeeping was very high. Our bedroom and bathroom were meticulously cleaned every day. We appreciated the quality toiletries. We made good use of the Club level floor which proved to be a bonus to my husband who spent a considerable amount of time in the hotel working. Each morning we enjoyed breakfast and delicious afternoon coffee and cookies. Tapas and pre dinner drinks ....a real treat! Unfortunately, I did have a mishap whilst staying at the hotel but wish to pay tribute to the wonderful treatment I received from the management and staff at the hotel.(Oliver I think and Marco?? This hotel really made our holiday special. It is right next to the Old Town and a ten minute walk to downtown shopping with the Metro close by. As a frequent traveller and user of Trip Advisor I would highly recommend this hotel. It was exceptionally good value for money. The two evening meals we enjoyed in "Osca" the hotel restaurant were the best meals we had in Montreal. Wonderful food with exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: marcia k
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Intercontinental was excellent. The hotel is beautiful, clean, spacious. Much nicer than the boutique hotel I had originally booked. The best part was the helpful staff. The Club level room was well equipped and the club lounge had a lovely breakfast and was also open for drinks and appetizers in the evening. Sandy went out her way to help with an important business project that I was completing. Access to the business centre and club lounge made this all possible. Sandy was professional, friendly, and extremely helpful. I have not met better staff anywhere in my travels in Canada or abroad. I am very pleased with my stay. I would recommend Hotel Intercontinental Montreal to friends and colleagues. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Facelifts are more than surface”
Reviews.Author: EqwineAcres
Reviews.Content: Twenty years ago the Intercontinental Hotel Montreal opened. Its appearance ushered in a new era of luxurious accommodations to world travelers. This year the hotel made its grand rebirth. This AAA/CA four diamond hotel boasts â€œthe perfect blend of intimate boutique hotel atmosphere and the peerless service of a luxuryous four-diamondâ€¦â€� Such a build-up leaves world travelers with high expectations for their Old Montreal sojourn. On this occasion there were expectations fulfilled and some unfulfilled. The arrival is standard high class. The prompt, cordial bellman weaves you from the lower entrance way to the escalator for the flight up to check-in. The $29 Cdn per diem valet parking is reasonable and allows for in and out privileges at any time. A mid-afternoon check-in proceeded smoothly with only minor delays due to the number of receptionists left managing the many guests in line. The Priority Club level rooms are completely redone. There are fewer rooms with expansive suites. Our corporate manager recently left so weâ€™re uncertain whether our change in requests was due to the management change or the renovation. The â€œsuiteâ€� room we entered was an oversized room with space for a couch. Our room had one pair of slippers for two guests. A call to the front desk quickly solved this problem. The scant three drawer clothing storage in the main entertainment unit gave prominent storage to the mini bar and coffee items leaving much of our items in our bag stored in the oversized closet. Our view from the corner room was partially obscured by the aluminum parapets jutting out from the higher floors. The bathroom had the corner shower, tub, and toilet all in one space. Another noticeable change is the relocation of the Club Room from its high floor location with sweeping panoramic views to a much smaller gathering spot immediately off the lobby with a view of the covered shopping mall outside the hotel rear. Evening Club Room hours are reduced to a two hour window from 5:30-7:30PM daily. The Conciergeâ€™s location in the lobby includes management of the Club Room. The Concierge staffs and services both the needs of the Hotel along with the evening refreshments. The breakfast hours operate with the same juggling act. On both days of our stay we watched the concierge help rebook flights for guests while the food dwindled, the milk in the automatic espresso machine went empty, and serving dishes and utensils remained on vacated tables. The evening appetizers disappeared more quickly than they were able to be replenished. The automatic wine dispenser failed to operate and the concierge delivered wine to the table by the glass. With some prompting the Manager in charge accommodated our wine requests. The Concierge staff is knowledgeable and most accommodating. They offer directions, restaurant choices, and best use of Montreal's' well-developed public transportation. Be sure to avail yourself of their expertise. The hotel is now competing with the likes of the W, Westin, and high end boutique hotels in a two square block radius. In 2010 the Intercontinental Montreal received the TrophÃ©e Ulysse from the Grand Prix du tourisme quÃ©bÃ©cois, Are they in competition for 2011?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a stunning view of downtown Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Doug H
Reviews.Content: Stayed there October 22nd for the McGill University open house. What was there not to like ... view was stunning ... room was beautiful & clean ... service was fast and friendly ... beds were quite comfortable ... and all this while being situated within the downtown Montreal experience!!! the Harris family

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Grent G
Reviews.Content: The hotel intercontinental is very well situated in old Montreal. The hotel is very modern and tasteful with very comfortable quiet room. The front desk staff are very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. Thanks to Jamil and Guy for the upgrade and wine in the room. One negative point Internet not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Helene D
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week, just for one night. Had some problems entering my room when I first received my keycard. It was not working correctly. But the staff at the Front Desk was really great. They offered me an upgrade, but as it was only for one night, I turned it down. So I reveived free internet instead. I ordered room service for the breakfast, it was fantastic. It came on time, as ordered. Really great hotel, great central location and fantastic staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful three nights”
Reviews.Author: EricandBettina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental in Montreal for three nights last weekend and loved it. The hotel is uncomplicated and well laid out. We had dinner there the first night and it was very good. The location is outstanding, one block from the old town with all it's charm and restaurants and galleries, a few blocks the other way and you are right by the shopping area with several amazing malls. You really cant go wrong. The rooms are well laid out and the staff is nice and professional. We took a cab from the airport which runs you about $50.00 with tip. On the way back out to the Airport we discovered a bus (route 747, easy to remember) which runs about 2 blocks from the airport and is $8.00 per person. Super easy and clean and convenient. Didnt take any longer either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kevin56
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in October. Hotel is perfectly situated on the outskirts of Old Montreal, just a few blocks from Notre Dame, one block from Metro. Hotel was spotless; room was really beautiful & had a luxury bathroom with fabulous rainfall shower. Buffet breakfast was included in room rate and made our stay a good value, even compared to other Holiday Inn properties in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our short stay.”
Reviews.Author: d24smith
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental while en route to a wedding in Eastern Ontario. This hotel is excellently located between historic Old Montreal and downtown. It is within a 5 minute walking distance to two Metro stations. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful which made our check-in fast. Our room was very spacious and we had an excellent view of downtown Montreal. The bed was very comfortable, and the linens clean. The bathroom was also quite large and very clean. At the time, one of the elevators was out of service for maintenance. It did make travelling from our upper floor hotel room to the lobby time consuming. We did not use the spa or pool, but did take a peek. The spa staff were very friendly, and let us take a look at pool and the other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal service!”
Reviews.Author: ABDCPA
Reviews.Content: I attended a week long tax seminar at the hotel and enjoyed my stay completely. The location of the hotel is convenient to the Metro and the underground city. The underground parking is connected to the hotel meeting center. I travel to Montreal frequently from my secondary home in Vermont and, if staying over night, always choose the Intercontinental. I have always found the staff to be friendly and attentive to me needs. I am looking forward to my stay this coming New Years Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in central location. Great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: traveller_spain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a family trip 2 nights at this hotel. The hotel is very central at a walking distance of the old city and metro. Room is big, clean and comfortable. Maybe is starting to show its age. The lobby service needed almost 30 minutes to deliver the luggage, which is disturbing after an intercontinental flight. We had dinner once at the restaurant. It was French food of very good quality and reasonable price, so much better than the overpriced restaurants at Place des Armes, that offer low quality food. Breakfast was also very good. I would choose this hotel again if I come back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “thanks for the "favors"”
Reviews.Author: heather g
Reviews.Content: well i am CURRENTLY staying at this hotel. I am a platinum ambassador status with priority club rewards. it is our anniversary and my birthday as well. well our group is staying at the crystal and WE WISH WE WERE TOO! we booked here because we thought we would be treated like a platinum guest and well we were wrong. after basically begging for an upgrade (which i requested weeks ago and which is promised on their website if you are ambassador status) we got it. we arrived in our room last night and its reeks of smoke and is average. well everytime i stay with this group they give you coupons for the club, drinks at the bar ect. as the website promises access to the club, free internet, and free breakfast, I was told if i wanted these things I had to pay $60 then 8 hours later it went up to $80. Why I will never know. The front desk manager as well as the staff are extremely rude. The front desk manager laughed in my face when I expressed my concerns. And when I called about the internet the front desk staff replied "well no you dont get it, but tonight i will do the favor". Thanks for the favors. I am confused why I pay $200 a year for absolutely no perks (you basically get the same with gold or silver). do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. staff is rude and discourteous, rooms are well below par (they look nothing like on the website), food is terrible, and although we only paid $150 a night.....I would have rather dished out the 20 or so dollars more because our friends are having an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and a great value for Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Caribbeantraveler11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a great pick for us. The hotel bar was convenient and the room was amazing. We had plenty of room and there was a speaker in the bathroom where you could hear the program that was on your TV. There was 24 access to the fitness center and also a spa and indoor pool with a great view of the city. You can call to reserve your room and ask for a higher floor with a great view. Our friends stayed on floor 22 and had a beautiful view of the city!

Reviews.Title: “The Suite was sweet”
Reviews.Author: renaissancewoman99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend getaway in Oct 2011 and it was thoroughly enjoyable. The Suite was very spacious (huge spa bathroom), bed was comfortable, staff was accomodating, and room service was great. They had a promotion on Expedia for a flight + 2 night hotel stay for virtually the same price as just return flights from Toronto (for 2 people). The location in old Montreal is ideal, and there are many great restaurants within walking distance. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. They have a bar just off the lobby advertised as an "absinthe lounge" which was very intriguing but we didn't get a chance to visit it. There was one elevator out of order for maintenance but this did not affect us at all, an elevator always came quickly. I agree with other reviewers that the room service was overpriced compared to local restaurants, but this is completely normal for any hotel in an urban centre.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Rob123235
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in August 2011 during a business trip. The room was very nice and clean. The service was great and everyone was friendly. The surrounding area was nice and I felt safe and secure the whole time. There were two issues I encountered during my stay. The first was the elevators. They were undergoing repairs and were very, very slow. There were line ups to use them and sometimes everyone had to wait for over 10 minutes to get one. They had a sign posted outside the elevator that said it was undergoing maintenance, but this appeared to be a rather permanent sign that was professionally prepared and posted. I suspect this has been an ongoing issue with this hotel. At one point there was a line up on my floor and we had to call the front desk as the elevator would not stop on our floor. We needed them to send staff to our floor to rescue us. The second issue I found was that everything was overpriced including the rooms and the extremely overpriced meals at the restaraunt. The hotel itself is overpriced compared to others and I would have stayed somewhere else if it was not for business and paid for by my employer. The evening when I arrived it was rather stormy outside and I was quite tired from the long flight. I ordered a modest meal from room service and it cost well over 3 times as much as I would have paid if I went to a local restaraunt. I ate breakfast at the hotel only once due to its astronomical prices. Other than these two issues, everything else was good. Next time I will stay at the Square Phillips, Delta or other hotel in the nearby area due to the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Granddog
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Montreal where we stayed at the Intercontinental Montreal. It is located at the beginning of the Old City. The staff was friendly, helpful and (at least) bi-lingual. The hotel is an amazing property. It is made up of two older buildings which are connected by land bridges. Between the properties, on the ground floor, is part of the underground shopping area. (Please be sure to check out the underground shopping as an attraction.) The whole area is covered by a glass roof but you definitely feel that you are outside! Our room was a corner room. Definitely large enough and comfortable enough for two. Beware that if you even move anything in the refrigerator you will be charged for it! However, there is enough room to place medication. The room was quite clean. The bathroom had both a tub and a shower as separate features. My only "complaint" was that the tv made an electronic multiple beep sound when turned on and off and it would be easy to wake another person in the room if one person can"t sleep and wants to watch tv. Perhaps the desk could have changed this feature but we never asked. We are definitely looking forward to a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: ETAY05
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with the hotel and concerige. The location of the hotel was also good. Although i did think that for such a good hotel , the chambermaids were a little unfriendly. The second night they forgot to replace my coffee ( and I am a coffee addict!), which they replace after a reminder to the front desk. The third night, they did so again and this time with a face to face reminder from my husband, they still did not replace it. SO it was a bit disappointing overall.

Reviews.Title: “Poor for the price”
Reviews.Author: puertogordito
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for a wedding and wish I did not. Way over priced and was distgusted at the fact that on top of the high price $220/n they did not even supply an internet connection - one was avaialbale at $14.5+tax. They suggested we could use a free connection - supplied by another organization - in the adjoining alleyway ... Bottled water was $7.50+tax and the mini-bar beer was more than the price at the bar. Asked for a sewing kit (supposedly not cost) but it never showed up. Some of the rooms we wvisited had broken reading lights.

Reviews.Title: “Pure pleasure”
Reviews.Author: TouristinParisFrance
Reviews.Content: The hotel is first class, excellent location, helpful staff and big, cmfotable rooms. I can only recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the city”
Reviews.Author: dfresh713
Reviews.Content: Montreal is a very beautiful city and this hotel added to the experience. I stayed here for a couple weeks for business, the room was always clean and the employees were very friendly. The only issues I had in a two week stay: 2 out of the 3 elevators were sometimes out of service Food is a bit pricey. Other than that, my next trip to Montreal I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Montreal”
Reviews.Author: christopher r
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for a week and returned home yesterday. The hotel is very nice although you can tell it was a "chain" hotel in the past and has been refurbished to make it look like a boutique hotel with dark furnishings and chandeliers. The room was lovely although the cleaning by the maid seemed to become less thorough as the week went on. The Concerge service was brilliant - any information needed about anything was provided in great detail and they checked us in on our return flights home as the guest computer was a bit slow. Our stay in Montreal was good but one thing that did get annoying was the focus on tipping everywhere we went. I appreciate that in winter they cannot rely on tourism but the constant reminder that the season ends soon and waiters/cab drivers/tour guides need to make as much money as they can now became too much. At times the service in the bars/restaurants became a bit artificial because you knew that staff were being extra nice to get a bigger tip. That said we didn't experience any poor service and had some lovely meals while we were there. The location of the hotel is great for visiting the old town and handy for the metro.The Eaton Centre and the main shops are a ten minute walk away. There is a great diner/restaurant around the corner on McGill plaza where you can get all kinds of meals but their breakfasts are excellent value. The food court and shops in the complex underneath the hotel are good but close quite early so we only used them once while there. If you are staying here request a high floor to get a good view - we were on the front overlooking the fountains/park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointed with the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BigTuna3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as the last stop on our honeymoon. The hotel itself is in a great location with Old Montreal on one side and downtown on the other. We had a room up on the 23rd floor which was nice with a great view. There were small cupcakes and a bottle of water there when we arrived... good start. A few tips: When we arrived in our room there was a card on the table which welcomed us to "Club Intercontinental" which meant we had free internet, access to the "club" room, free breakfast, cocktails and a number of other perks. We thought we had been upgraded because we had mentioned on our reservation that we were on our honeymoon. Long story short is that those cards are in all the rooms on the 23rd floor and we were not actually part of the "club". Don't get your hopes up if you're in one of those rooms! We found it very strange that the cleaning staff knocked on the door at 9am to clean the room and had proceeded to open the door before we could even get dressed. Good thing we had the chain on the door! I suggest you do the same. They came back again at 10am (we were still there) even though I had told them to come back in the afternoon when we would be gone. The next morning they showed up to clean the room at 9:30am even though we were suppose to be checking out at 11am that day. They're really eager to get those rooms cleaned! The cleaning staff had taken away our water glasses when they cleaned and didn't replace them. We called twice for replacement glasses but they never arrived. Since we didn't have much luck with water glasses we called to see if we could get two wine glasses sent up and we were informed that there would be a charge of $.75 per glass. We declined on principal thinking that with the amount you pay for a room, especially on the 23rd floor, the least you could do is get a wine glass. Perhaps this is how it works in all Luxery hotels.. I don't know. $14 per day for internet and $22 for parking. Overall a disappointing stay for the price you pay. I think we're done with Luxery hotels in general. Unless we're on a companies expense account it just isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lacks service”
Reviews.Author: house007
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great area, concierge was great and I think tipping goes a long way. I had confirmation of a room with a king size bed and they tried arguing with me that it was for 2 doubles even though it was printed right on the sheet. They tried telling me everything was booked and then when I said that I would just go to another hotel, they magically found a room. On our second night, the fire strobe light went off for 2 hours til about 2:00 am, so it was impossible to sleep. They apologized and said that a manager would contact us the next morning but never did and they wouldn't refund our money for that night.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in downtown montreal with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Munro S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I use this property several times a year when we visit Montreal. These visits are sometimes business and sometimes pleasure. The hotel staff are excellent, friendly and knowledgeable, always willing to go the extra mile. The hotel is an upmarket hotel with great ambience. I believe that the rates provide good value. The hotel also has an excellent club lounge. The location is great becasue there is easy access to the Business District and is very close to Old Montreal. A great place to stroll or enjoy a nice evening out. The hotel is connected to the underground city providing easy access to business, shopping, recreation and lots more. We will continue to use this property because of the friendliness of the staff and the great location

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: dopplerdog
Reviews.Content: Central location, close to Metro, walking distance to many restaurants. Only needed cab once and that was to get back to airport. Rooms very clean and nicely appointed. Only complaint is the high charge for internet considering the room rate itself was high.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Nothing bad to say”
Reviews.Author: Kiat L
Reviews.Content: Great location. Concierge sevice very helpful. Overall, great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a great hotel - never will return”
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for years but not recently. We decided to try it again. It was a premium property but has been completely redecorated very cheaply. The rooms have dark cheap furniture and depressing burgundy carpets and drapes. The drapes are made of cheap nylon. Everything looks like is was imported from the lowest-cost provider in Asia. The bathrooms remain large and very good. The lobby was elegant and is now decorated with fake fur walls and back-lit plastic panels. The elevators were not working properly and none of the TV's in the entire hotel were working at all. The staff at the front desk claimed they knew nothing about this. The hotel always had poor parking and relies on valet parking. It can take a half an hour for your car to arrive. Avoid this hotel. It was once great but seriously mismanaged now.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable, but for the wrong reasons”
Reviews.Author: Cdngirl_68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental 8 nights (3 separate trips) in August. The last time I was there, the front desk staff asked if it was my first time at the hotel, which shocked me. Certainly they can tell frequency of stays, right? I was given a room across from the spa and next to the elevators, not my favourite spot, but it was late, I hadn't eaten, and I just needed to get to bed for an early morning meeting. However, when I woke in the morning, there was no soap, shampoo or conditioner in my bathroom! I called the front desk twice and was promised quick delivery, as I said I was in a hurry. Twenty minutes later still nothing so I popped over the spa and 'borrowed' their shampoo. Surprisingly, this huge plastic bottle was still in my room later that day, as was my room service tray from the night before. I like the rooms at the IC, they are very comfortable, great beds, but c'mon, the small details mean a lot to those who travel so much. And no free wifi! Time to get to know your frequent customers.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky, but well-appointed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WebsterCook
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and well laid- out with extremely comfortable bed. Conveniently located near the French quarter. Staff generally very attentive, but the concierge was rarely available and not very helpful. A great little cafe downstairs, which was a handy alternative to the French options in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: momofliv
Reviews.Content: I had hoped to stay in Old Town, but found a great rate at the IC through Priceline. We were in an upper story corner room with a great view. The room seemed newly renovated and everything was crisp and clean and comfortable. Great bathroom! The elevators were being renovated so getting up and down was a little slow, but it didn't matter because we weren't in a hurry! Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. My only very minor complaint would be the placement of the furniture in the room was a little odd. It was a difficult to see the TV from the bed. The location was very nice, only a short walk down to the quieter end of Old Town. The parking garage was underground and not terribly expensive at $22 per day. Overall, our stay at the IC was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “nice one night stay”
Reviews.Author: bobie
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Intercontinental and found it to be quite nice especially for the price I paid on Priceline.$144.00. The room was large and clean accomodating 3 of us very easily. The location is excellent. Only 10 minute walk to St.Catherine and 20 minute walk to Old Montreal area. Had to wait for the elevator a few times since one of them was out of service,but nothing to unbearable. Nice flat screen tv,bed was very comfy,bathroom large and toileteries very nice. We were only on the fourth floor so we didn't have much of a view,( a condo) but I guess that is what you get for the special price. We were fortunate to get into the room early by noon. My only minor complaint would be that the reception was not particularly warm and welcoming. I have had better welcomes at Hampton Inns. Hotel parking is independent and a little expensive at $22.00 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest IC I have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravels
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at ICs in 4 countries, but Montreal will be our last. First, the staff was extremely rude -- we found this to be unique to this hotel--everyone else we met in Montreal was friendly and helpful. (And while I am an American tourist, I speak some Friench, don't wear jeans and flipflops, etc.) Most importantly, we were awakened every morning of our vacation at around 7.30 am by what sounded like hammering. We complained to the management, who said thay would "look into it." Big deal. At check-out, I asked for some compensation for our trouble. The very rude receptionist left us waiting a very long time--and finally comped us the internet fee (a mere $40), which seemed to me the least they could do. The whole experience left us pretty unhappy, as we are (were) brand-loyal. Then to top it all off, it turned out that they had put on hold on my credit card for an additional $900--despite the fact that we had prepaid our $1200. bill. So I would suggest that if you have to stay there, don't stay on the lower floors. Except that for most of the visit, 2 of 3 elevators were out of order--which matters in a 26 story hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star hotels, with some 2 star staff”
Reviews.Author: AnAreEye
Reviews.Content: Pros: As expected, 4 star amenities. Cons: 3 interaction with front-desk staff, 2 were unpleasant. They don't know the difference between 'upscale' and 'rude'. Also, used glassware are not always replaced by cleaning staff in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: blindlemonpie
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from 7 nights at the Intercontinental. I was attending a conference at the Palais de Congresse which was just across the road so the location was ideal. The hotel also sits right on the edge of the old town and is a short walk to many of Montreal's attractions. The room was large and very quiet. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. My only complaint is in relation to the elevator renovation work that is taking place. One morning I waited 10 minutes for an elevator before giving up, taking two staircases and ending up in a staff only area which resulted in some strange looks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Nothing Special...”
Reviews.Author: BigWesNASTY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a few of my buddies this past weekend and the hotel was pretty dope! We booked 3 rooms through Hotwire and they listed the InterContinental Montreal as a 4.5 star hotel... In my opinion the hotel wasn't anything special and should've been rated a max of 4 stars... (We paid more to get a nicer hotel but could've paid a little less and stayed somewhere that's just as nice such as the Embassy Suites or Sheraton). The rooms were nice; they had a lot of room, comfy beds, big bathrooms, nice views, nice TVs. The only thing that was pretty pure about the TV's was that the Cable was dog so the channel quality was poor. Other than that the hotel staff was great and the hotel had some nice features such as a fitness room, sauna and steam room. The hotel had a pool and a patio over-looking the city but they were both garbage... The pool was a small two-lane pool and the patio was pretty small to... Also everything in the hotel is expensive; there's a mini-bar that is monitored by sensors so if you move something you're charged, the WiFi is $15 a day... Who the hell pays for WiFi anymore? And a friggen bottle of water is $7??? Overall, it was a nice hotel in a great location within walking distance to everything, but its definitely not 4.5 star worthy...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: michael_zrh
