Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Montreal is a nice place to stay. WE stayed on two occasions in a corner inspiring view room in August and both time stayisfied with the room. the renovation is a success however, the bathrooms stay the intercontinental standards and are nice but not newly renovated. one downturn was the inadequacy of the reservation system. for a trip with pre-payment apparently the room rate was not charged to the CC at the time of booking, which still needs to be verified. one downturn in the rooms are the constant noise of the minibar. it had to be completely unplugged to be able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: X-O75
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice experience downtown Montreal. The atmosphere and the deco were very nature and contemporary oriented, very nice feeling. We had a terrific corner suite, we loved it. Lots of space with a fantastic view of Montreal. Short distance from metro station. A great Intercontinental experience !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jebcoent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 8 & 9 as we we're attending U2 concert. Room rate was a little higher than I liked but that could be said about most hotels in Montreal that weekend with 80,000 people in town for a concert each night. We chose a rate that included breakfast and valet parking which basically worked out to free breakfast. The rooms were very nice and larger than I would have expected for a downtown location. Beds were very comfortable. Actually meant to check what kind they were since we are in the market to replace ours at home. The bathroom, again very nice and large, had a tub and separate large corner shower. The room rate does not include internet access which I think in this day and age should be standard but this seems to be the norm for luxury hotels. For those that want internet access, remember to ask for the $10/nt package when you check in which includes internet and long distance. If you use the internet without it, it will cost you $5 more per night and does not include long distance. The internet is wired, not wireless which is a bit of an annoyance when both of you have a computer plus the phones etc. but I now tend to pack an old wireless router when I travel to avoid the problem. As we were there for the U2 weekend the Metro had a special deal for unlimited use passes. Check-in was fast and efficient especially consider the number of people checking is as we arrived. When checking in the the front desk staff asked whether we were there for U2 and we provided were with an info package regarding and advised that they had a supply of the Metro passes there. Being able to buy them at the hotel was a blessing since the lineups to buy them at Metro station were very long. Hotel is right between 2 stations about a 5 minute walk in either direction. Not sure about getting to them underground because the whether was beautiful anytime we had to get there. The breakfast included in the rate was a buffet with was good and well above par for a hotel breakfast. Car never left the garage while we were there so only had to call the valet when we were leaving. Called 5 minute ahead of leaving the room and waited less than a minute for the car to pull up. All hotel staff we dealt with were pleasant and eager to help. Not sure about any of the other facilities as we were kept pretty busy all weekend. Overall a great stay. Would stay here again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Long Weekend in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Capt-Canuck5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here during the Jazz Fest. I have to admit I was a bit uncertain about our stay considering some of the mixed reviews, but I saw no evidence of anything that would discourage us from staying again. The hotel is well located just a short walk to Old Montreal (a great breakfast/lunch place is just 10 minutes away...leave the hotel, and then turn right towards Old Montreal..it's the great shop with all kinds of herbs in the windows!) and a bit of a further walk to Downtown Montreal. Our room was spacious and well appointed and suiting the boutique hotel image of this hotel. Service was always friendly and we enjoyed two visits to their Absinthe Bar as well. This was a great boutique hotel in the heart of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chi_54
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay here on a trip with friends. The concierge and front desk were very friendly and very knowledgeable. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was great as it provided both a shower and a tub. Regarding temperature control: My room was fine and the thermostat was working perfectly fine. I know there is another review that said that there were issues with this, but I encountered no problems and indeed could easily change the temperature of the room. Location: The location is great: It is close to the metro as well as the old town. There are also plenty of good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Knowlegable Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: anmold
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, and concierge that is very helpful. The location is perfect. We were able to walk all of Old Montreal and not have to worry about parking or taking public transportation. A big let down was that the pool closed at 7 pm and even earlier on the weekends! That is the first time I've ever heard of a pool closing at such an early hour. Most close at 10 pm. We were really looking forward to soaking in the pool after spending all day walking through Montreal, and were quite disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad room AC”
Reviews.Author: ande1480
Reviews.Content: The thermostat cannot be adjusted. It has an auto setting that prevents you from setting the temperature to what you want. After a few minutes, it shuts off and goes back to the hotel default temperature. Probably an energy program related system but why bother putting in a thermostat if guests can't change the temperature. We were hot every night because we could not cool down the room. 2 visits from maintenance to fix it but the guy said that's how the system is designed. "What do you want? A fridge?" Thanks for the judging... They didn't clean out used glasses from the room. What gives?

Reviews.Title: “More of a very good Crowne Plaza, which is in no way a negative”
Reviews.Author: MaKSiNG
Reviews.Content: Service: Good service. Very courteous. Room: 2 Double Bed and Corner King room. Good standard. Good size. Clean. Business hotel standard. 32" LCD TV. Minibar - of the automatic type which charges you if you move something. Bathroom: Good size. Separate bath and shower cubicle. No shower gel and shampoo dispensers but little bottles. Location: Good location. 10 mins walk from both downtown Montreal and old town Montreal (in-between the 2). Additional: Paid for valet parking which works fine but is difficult if you later need anything from the car. Long wait if you ask the Bellboys to retrieve something for you and a slight walk if you decide to go get it yourself. Good breakfast buffet if a little small, but good choice including fresh, made to order omelettes. WiFi chargeable. Although we enjoyed our stay and hotel is good, I simply didn't feel it was worthy of the InterContinental label. Â More of a very good Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and room!!”
Reviews.Author: TigerSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Don't valet park - unless it's just for your first day-- extremely expensive! There are many places nearby that are half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Second time just as good!”
Reviews.Author: Lori_D_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second visit to the Intercontinental in Montreal and were just as pleased as the first time. Requested early check in and they had the rooms available which was wonderful after the long drive. Rooms spacious and very comfortable. Beds are SO comfortable. Hotel staff very pleasant and helpful. Hotel is in a great location -- steps away from Old Montreal -- easy walking distance to shopping on St. Catharines St. We walked to Swartz for their smoked meat sandwich -- about a 30 minute walk from hotel. Had supper at Gibby's --food was excellent (a bit on the pricey side), and a fantastic wine selection.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: abachhan
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for four days. very nice hotel in old montreal. Excellent location. near to notre dame basilica, victoria square. Surrounding neighbourhood is top notch. easy to take public transport. as for the hotel, it is top class. rooms are clean, comfy and you can have a great view of harbor. hotel staff is very friendly. most of them can speak English. Conceirge desk is very helpful. As with every five start hotels, room service and mini bar can devoid you of a lot of money. Only issue was expensive parking if you plan to have a car. will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucymfinch
Reviews.Content: This place was gorgeous! We stayed in one of the least expensive rooms, and it was still the most beautiful hotel room we have ever stayed in. Very close to Old Montreal. We kept our car parked all weekend and walked everywhere. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: JonnyCanuck99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a romantic evening with my wife. The room and washroom were larger than any other hotel room I've ever seen. It was well decorated, very clean and quiet (we stayed on the 23rd floor). Our room didn't have a particularly nice view (inside room) but that wasn't a factor for us. The King--sized bed and pillows were very comfortable. We did use the hotel bar which was rather small but fine for us (good strong drinks). Its well within walking distance to old Montreal and right across the street from the congress center. The TV was on a bureau parallel to the bed so the angle was a little strange, but we weren't there to watch tv. The one negative was perhaps the price, the room originally cost me $336/night (+taxes) but they have a price match policy and it was reduced. I checked the price on the weekend we were there and it had gone down to around $220 (+taxes). At $220 its well worth it, but $330 is too much. Valet parking was practical and at a competitive price ($30/night). Terrific hotel, nothing bad to say about it and I've definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Vraiment un joli hotel de Montreal”
Reviews.Author: arccurls
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Clean, comfortable beds and excellent service. Close to Old MOntreal. Excellent restaurant in the hotel. Breakfast was plentiful and well presented. Directly across the street from the 'metro'. Overall, a good choice and would return !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: DeuxLoves
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the U2 Montreal tour in July. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to vieux port and close to transportation. Valet was tricky on the busy street as we drove in, but we forgot about it once the car was secured underground. The hotel and its immediate surroundings were completely dead since it was the weekend. Staff was very accommodating. We even came home to mini "intercontinental" cupcakes one night. Be forewarned though, you will pay dearly for your drinks at the in-house bar. Since the hotel is not particularly close to anything else, it is tempting to go there, but make sure you keep an eye on your bar tab!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and expensive”
Reviews.Author: IowaPatti
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is lovely - we had a really pretty room on the 23rd floor with the sweet summer deals package. We liked the hotel, but were surprised by some of the fees and taxes - a rollaway bed was $35 per night which is pretty high, and the taxes were about 13.5% which is a lot. The summer deal gave us half-off the 3rd night but the hotel was still quite expensive. However, we liked the service - the view - and the room was very pretty and it worked for our family of 2 adults - 2 teens. The hotel restaurant has an excellent breakfast buffet which is $23 pp CAD but there is a food court beneath the hotel and below the office building next door which has cheaper food. Very close to the sights of Montreal and easy access to the Metro and the Bixi bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romeros
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was reluctant to stay at the hotel and since I booked with Hotwire; canceling was out of the question. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was newly renovated, Rooms are Spacious and very comfortable. Huge Screen TV. The hotel is only 10 minutes away (by Foot) from the main street ST-Catherine were you find all the stores. I will definitely stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: Unlike some of the previous reviews I read about this hotel, I thought it was great. Besides being centrally located, across the street from the convention center and steps away from old Montreal, I found all the staff welcoming and helpful. It made no difference that I spoke very little French. The room was extemely comfortable and the bathroom was huge having a full tub as well as a stall shower. I was there for a week attending a conference and after a full day and night's activities, the hotel was a welcome oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly noisy”
Reviews.Author: irishprincess76
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Intercontinental Hotels around the world and my experience at ICMontreal was a bit disappointing. My room (1908) overlooked two roofs on which there where some huge fan, operating all night, with a very loud noise. It was impossible to sleep without ear plugs! Many customers staying in the same rooms on other floors complained about the same thing. The hotel answered that there was nothing to do about that. Not the answer you expect for 219 dollar a night!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Wonderful Staff Best Location Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: RandB2005
Reviews.Content: My family husband, Son, daugther in law & 2 grand kids loved this hotel. We were on th e18th floor my son & grandkids the 17th. There room a suite was so nice wrap around windows nice natural light, a view of the fountain and all Montreal. Once we got settled with the help of friendly bell staff we we off, to Cirque De Soiel.My grand kids were amazed so nice to have the big top. That is all they talked about was Cirque Totem. We walked subway or biked it all over. SO MUCH FUN!! Jamil was our concegere. so helpful he recommended outrageous restaurants. Explained how to bike Montreal use the machine to rent a bike and return to another location.got tickets to the BIo Dome.When he saw us in the lobby he was so friendly and accomandating making sure we had a fun filled 2 days. I loved this hotel the location was great we all sleep really good. If you can get a suite with a breathtaking view its so nice. The club for breakfast and pm cocktails is a worth the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad experience with one of the duty managers”
Reviews.Author: MrsSmith002
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location; close to Congress Center and downtown. The staff is exceptionally friendly and works over time to meet your needs. The duty manager Guy was super and always had a smile on his face, he help us with issues (rude and unprofessional) we had with Alex the first duty manager we met. Big thanks also to Gerry the best concierge I have ever seen. The rooms are cozy with comfortable beds and lots of pillows, with fridge and coffee pot. Good breakfasts served. Internet is not free 10 $ a day. I will definitely stay at the Intercontinental when I return to Montreal. Thanks for everyone making my stay a very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: markjenkins1966
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Montreal so I was very excited. We had booked a 2-bed room with an irresistible view. When we arrived, we got to our room but we had been upgraded to a suite with a king size bed. Since I was with another male friend, the king size bed was not do-able - it's why we had booked (AND received a confirmation on) a room with 2 double beds. Thanks for the upgrade, but the "upgraded" view was horrible and the sleeping arrangements were unacceptable. When we went back down to the lobby to request our confirmed room. The desk attendant told us that there wasn't a room ready for us and "I don't know when it will be ready". It was around 4:00pm and we said we could wait for our room. "It could be ready at EIGHT for all I know," she spat. We then were asked to go get our luggage out of the upgraded room so they could hold it for us until our new room was ready.At this point, we just wanted our room after our long flight but we were also hungry so we decided to get something to eat. In the meantime, my friend and I discussed that what SHOULD have happened at this point was that the clerk should have apologized for the mix up (which she didn't), offered someone to go get our bags FOR us (which she didn't) and comp us some sort of meal at the hotel (which they didn't). None of this was our fault (since our original confirmation had CONFIRMED a room that we never got. And we ended up suffering for it. I will tell you that the service at this hotel is horrible. We waited in line to initially check in for over 30 minutes; when we came back down for our right room, we waited for another 15 minutes. When we got back to check back in for our room after dinner, we waited (with 2 couples who were livid for having to wait so long) for over 20 minutes. I asked the concierge to help and call someone and she said i would have better luck waiting in the lobby. yeah, right. Then they said our luggage was already placed in our new room. It wasn't. We finally got our room which was amazing. Great view and great accommodations. But GETTING the right confirmed room wasted half of our first day of vacation. Thanks Intercontinental. Oh, and I forgot to mention that during our initial check in, another hotel guest asked to see the manager to show him damage to his car that the valet caused. good thing we had a taxi. Maybe there were new employees working. I don't care. They shouldn't be working on a busy weekend (Canada Day, fireworks expo, Jazz Festival) without being properly trained first. I blame management for that. I am a manager in customer service so I can say that and still sleep at night. Pool closed at 7:30pm. Not good. Would've had enjoyed it staying open a little later - say 10:00?

Reviews.Title: “Lying to my face at checkout!”
Reviews.Author: disgustedtraveller12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from June 29 to July 2. At checkout, we were told we had run up a $152 bill from the minibar. We had put items in empty areas, not touching the bottom of the shelf. The clerk said she would remove the charges and we left, not authorizing anything. A few days ago, I saw charges on my credit card account. I sent an email via the hotel's website - no response. I am disputing all the charges, but who needs the aggravation for something we were told was "all set."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good hotel, just a little overpriced on my budget”
Reviews.Author: occhi21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were waiting for last min specials for a flight with Continental, so we booked this hotel last min. We won this hotel via Priceline w/a bid of $225 usd, w/ taxes (Canadian taxes are 13%)it came out to be $270 usd. We stayed over the Canada/Fourth of July & Jazz festival weekend. When we arrived at the hotel we tried to check in at 12:30pm, they said the hotel was too full and to come back in two hours. We did and still were rejected from checking in at 3pm, yet our paperwork said 3pm check in. Finally at 4pm they let us check in. The room was located on 19 floor facing the river with nice views. The room was spotless and bed was a king so comfortable. The room had high ceilings and was very spacious with a desk, and ottoman. The bathroom was also spotless and huge with both a shower and bathtub. The hotel offers the guests a rob as well.We also liked the keurig coffee maker. The indoor pool was very nice located on the 10 floor, within the gym. The pool also has a roof top deck in which it has lounge chairs facing the convention center. The hotel is located across the street from the convention center and three blocks from Norte Dame. They offer self parking on the 9 floor which costs $22 cad a day. Around the block of the hotel during the weekend if you are lucky you can find street parking. I would def stay at this hotel again, but only if I got a better deal. I read someone who booked the same hotel via priceline won at $110, but they booked early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice digs, poor front desk experience”
Reviews.Author: atlfuzzy
Reviews.Content: This is a well located luxury type hotel in Montreal. It's proximity to Metro and Old Town made it a good choice for our recent trip. I would not stay here again, based on troubles at check in. We reserved, quite a long while back, a room with two beds that was described as with "View". We got to the front desk and waited thirty (yes, 30) minutes to get to the clerk. There was a line of about six people in front of us and two clerks at the front desk. The guests were clearly frustrated, as were the clerks. I am not sure what was going on, but it was a rather stressful scene. Finally we took our turn with an agent, and finally were given keys to our room. When we entered the room, we were surprised to see one bed. And no view. This was not the room I reserved. We were not in a position to sleep in the same bed so this would not work. We went back down to the front desk, had to wait in line again (20 minutes this time) and both of the clerks were on walkie talkie devices and seemed very agitated. This time we got another clerk (should have gotten name). We informed her we went to our room, and were given the wrong room type. I asked to be moved to the correct room. She sighed and went back to the back office, came back out and then told us it may be "as late as 8 oclock before it's ready if you want to be moved..you need to go get your luggage, check it at bell stand and come back later, as that room type was not ready yet". She was very curt and cold in her tone. After doing what she said, we thought to ourselves that the professional thing for her to have done was to APOLOGIZE for their mixup in giving me the wrong room and then SENT STAFF up to the room to get the luggage and hold it for us. It was not right for me to have had to go get my own luggage in a self described "FIVE STAR" hotel and take it down to the basement once again to the bellstand. The room was comfortable once we finally got to it. The accommodations were satisfactory. The service WAS NOT. Should have stayed at the newer Westin across the street. People and service can make all the difference in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: NYCandworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite horrible. I arrived here after a long drive. I even called the property one hour before my arrival to confirm my selected room was ready. At arrival I was " upgraded " the clerk told me from the double with view I paid for to a king with no view. This was actally not an upgrade at all particularly when 2 beds were needed and they charge more to reserve a room with a view. Real nice! It took 45 minutes to get a correct room. It took another half hour to get our luggage and 2 trips to the lobby to find it. I told the manager Alex I was upset and he said I should have called rather than come down. To make up for the confusion, he offerred me half off hotel dinner. When I expressed no interest he told me I could not be satisfied. I am glad this Intercontinental trains management to blame the customer for hotel errors. We wound up eating dinner at the hotel because the front desk delay ran so late everywhere else was closed. Half off ran about equal to full price for comparable quality outside the hotel. The next day I asked the concierge for a restaurant suggestion in chinatown. He gave me a name and said they do not take reservations. We got there and waited while other people who had rservations were seated. The problems at this property start from the top. The management is arrogant and their replies to other people on here seem to reflect it. Next time, I will go with one of the better rated hotels and hopefully avoid the bad service and attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Montreal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diane32724
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Montreal was so luxurious! The rooms were beautifully decorated. They were very spacious and had so many amenities. The bed was so comfortable. The bathroom had a separate bathtub and shower. The bathrooms were very spacious. The bathroom had a tv speaker in it. The elevators were very fast and the ice machines were centrally located on each floor. The staff at the hotel was very prompt and courteous. The hotel was in an ideal location. Two blocks from the Notre Dame Basilica and close to the old part of Montreal. This was such a lovely hotel. I can not imagine anyone being disappointed with this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star hotel - recommended at its price point”
Reviews.Author: PFoggSydney
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel. Close to the Old Town and comfortable walk to cbd. On the metro. The corner room was spacious and very good value for a long stay. The Club lounge was above average for this standard of hotel and worth the additional cost. The only negative experience was the laundry service, donâ€™t trust it to wash sensitive fabrics. Excellent local BYO French bistro ,a cab fare away at Le P'tit Plateau

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Business Hotel Old Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: grmartineau
Reviews.Content: The Intercontentinental is a top quality hotel located across from the Convention Centre (Palais des Congres), 2 blocks from Notre-Dame Street (Beautify Notre-Dame Cathedral) and 5 minute walk from Saint Paul street where you find bistros, cafes, boutiques. Opposite way, you walk 10 minute to famous St. Catherine street. Clientele of hotel is mostly business and well to do tourists. Large rooms - well appointed, internet access, large modern bathroom, very comfortable bed and very nice view of either Montreal city or St Lawrence river. Also good expensive restaurant, bar, exercise room. Excellent front desk and concerciege service as well as room service. There is also a corner store and pharmacy one block from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, A little over priced”
Reviews.Author: mdavidson072
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this beautiful and very centrally located hotel. Easy access for people traveling on business in Montreal. A little over priced when I found cheaper locations of equal value.

Reviews.Title: “Management has no grip”
Reviews.Author: FirstBruno
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a weekend during which a big motor race was being held. There was not much sign of this in the hotel or in the parts of the city we visited. Indeed, Montreal seemed to be deserted. There were never less that five taxis outside the hotel and the streets were empty. The hotel is entered through a grubby lobby littered with porters' luggage trollies. One then takes a narrow, mean, escalalator to the reception area. There were a few flowers there of the sort one can buy at petrol stations. We arrived late on a Friday evening and could not hear what the clerk was saying because of loud music emanating from a disco We then found our way to our room on the 23rd floor. This was sold as an inspiring corner room, with views in two directions. indeed it did have two views, one of which was of the another part of the hotel, a few feet away. This for over 700 Canadian dollars a night, without taxes, breakfast not included. When we inspected the bathroom, we found that three were no hand towels or face flannels nor foot towel. There was one small bar of soap for the shower, bath and handbasin. There was one small plastic bottle of shower gel, however. There was only one bath robe. We needed more clothes hangars and asked for them. When they had not arrived after an inordiinate wait, I rang and was told that since the hotel was full, things took more time. This was like saying that the hotel was full, so we should not expect hot water. I should have realised that management was incompetent a few days before leaving London when I received a telephone call telling me that because of this motor race, I would have to pay for our entire stay in advance. This was despite the fact that I had secured the reservation with my credit card. Notwithstanding the price of the room, the management were unable to procure that the carpet was vacuumed while there Oh and at breakfast, ask forma coffee pot to be left on the table. There was no visible management in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Go there if you need an expesive room, front desk attitude and poor service”
Reviews.Author: windfootsteps
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel thinking that I'd get good value for money. There was the money part allright. The rest, not so much. First bad suprise: no access to the lounge even though I work for a major client and they have an agreement with them. Second act: I needed my business suit cleaned for early next morning to attend a meeting. They somehow managed to loose it and I made to my meeting....Two hours late. Some yahoo from the front desk leaves a message statint that they wanted "to chat" about my mishap. Maybe because I called earlier and let them know in no uncertain terms my unhappiness about it. It didn't matter what language I used, in English I got evasive bs and in French I got Parisian complex attitude. This is not a hotel I'd stay again and I don't recommend it unless you're into self-inflicting punishment. The only saving grace was the laundry and cleaning staffs who did their best to correct what the mediocre front desk staff couldn't or wouldn't do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: vancouvergirl4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in June to celebrate our anniversary. My husband is in the military and this was our first time seeing each other in 2 months. I emailed the hotel ahead of time that I would be coming in early on an overnight flight and asked if possible for my room to be ready before the standard 4pm check in time. I never did get a response to my email. The bellmen were very helpful at the hotel and brought my bags to check in. At check in, I was told my room wouldn't be ready until 4pm and to come back then. I asked them if it was possible to get a room upgrade as I'm entitled to one if one is available as a platnium elite member, I was told I booked a nice room already and didn't get an upgrade. I asked them to call me on my cell phone when my room was ready and I went out to explore the city. I came back at 2 to check on my room even though I hadn't been called and was told that my room had been ready for some time. Overall, the hotel is very nice. We booked a corner view inspiring room which had windows on 2 different walls. The view was amazing. It looked out over the river and Old Montreal. The hotel room had recently renovated but the bathroom looked like it was still from the 80's. There were stains on the tiles around the toilet and water stains on the ceiling. The bathtub was quite small, not a soaker tub, the minimum I'd expect in a hotel like this. The cleaning service was always quite fast and they did a good job. The location is good. A short walk to Old Montreal and Rue St. Paul which is a very fun atmosphere especially with a Canucks playoff game on. Old Montreal is electric at night and didn't ever feel unsafe walking back at 1 in the morning. The night before checkout, I advised the front desk that I needed a later checkout, also something that I'm entitled to as a platnium elite member. I was told that I could check out late but I'd be charged for it. I had to remind them that I'm entitled to a later check out and got the feeling that they were doing me a big favour allowing me to check out at 2 instead of 12. I would not stay here again. This hotel is not worth the $900+/night that it costs this weekend especially with the total lack of service from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: soniawasabi
Reviews.Content: Very good staff. The have been useful and kind every time I have requested something. Beautiful lobby and underground connections with shops, restaurants and metro. The room was comfortable and big but with small light during the day. I have had dinner at the restaurant. Very good paying affordable prices. Everything looks clean and neat. The "Java U" down in the corner is a great place to have breakfast or lunch. I think this is a good location if you have the chance to spend some time in Old Montreal. Its near Rue Saint Paul which is the "main" street to get around in this neighborhood. By the other hand it is 4 blocks away from Saint Catherine street, the right place to do some shopping and the Place des Arts where the are plenty of shows, museums and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb hotel, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: khamen77
Reviews.Content: First thing: do sign up for the Intercontinental Club upgrade! $10 a day is well worth it. It comes with included breakfast and afternoon tea in their lounge. The room we got is beautiful, facing towards the fountain in the complex across, overlooking the multi-coloured glass walled convention center. Very well decorated. This being a business class hotel, did not have amenities such as a microwave which would have been most helpful for families with young kids. Location-wise, it is great. 10-15 minutes walk to downtown shopping areas, to the Chinatown area and to the old port area. It is also in between two Metro stations, Square-Victoria and Place D'Armes. A short ride from the Biodome/Olympic Park and to LaRonde. This hotel is also right on top of one part of the Underground City, which features shops along the number of connected Metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: goonybones
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, friendly, and had a good value. From the moment I checked in, to the moment I checked out, the staff was very helpful and curteous. I would definitely stay here again. Montreal was also a very lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jinapsan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful hotel. The room was large and elegant. The bathroom was also large with wonderful amenities. Bed was comfortable. The location was central to Montreal. But i believe what really made this hotel special was its staff: IIncredibly friendly and helpful. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay in 5 star luxury”
Reviews.Author: sdcowie
Reviews.Content: Had a very relaxing stay at this hotel, in the heart of Old Montreal and so near and close to downtown and all amenities. The Rooms Division manager who checked us out was extremely friendly and efficient. All staff were excellent and very friendly. Well done, would recommend a must stay, wish i could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Sleep, Great Absinthe Bar!”
Reviews.Author: mowgeli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights with my husband in a Club King Room. Hotel was in a great location for all the things we wanted to do. Old Montreal is at your doorstep and the subway is connected to the hotel for moving about. St. Catherine Street is a 3 minute walk for great shopping. Sleep was fantastic. We were on the 25th floor and heard NOTHING. We hit the absinthe bar one night for a late night drink and enjoyed the private room we had to sip on pure absinthe. Very fun experience. We had access to the club intercontinental which gave us free breakfast and free early evening food and unlimited drinks, including hard liquor and wine from 5:30 to 7:30, WIFI and papers to read in the club room. All this came in handy for us. Great place to relax an fuel up after shopping and touring around. I did find that the hotel and the room were dark in lighting. I found myself struggling to find a spot with good light to organize things or get ready for the day. It feels like an "evening" hotel even in the daytime. It was clean but my washroom was looking a bit old and in need of a new tub. Elevators were slow and one was under repair more than once during our stay. We had a useless view from our room. Faced another wing of the hotel. We looked down onto the shopping concourse and had to strain our necks to see any view of the city. The hotel is attached to a great concourse for shopping, and includes a part of the Berlin Wall, which was given to the City of Montreal for its birthday. Very interesting. I would stay here again. It was a very relaxing stay. GREAT location for doing anything in this city. It was funky and romantic at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem, wonderful peronalised attendance..”
Reviews.Author: Wonderful1001
Reviews.Content: thank you Dulce ( reservations), thank you Lea (our receptionist, and ..Club Inter host, at the time..). We have received the upgrade to the Tourelle Suite ( on 13 floor, as we checked in late on a Friday evenenig, driving a mere 5 and a half hours from New York)- the higher floors were taken by 9 PM which is quite understandable. First of all the hotel is new , only 20 years in built and recently renovated, there is no doubt that it was clean and well maintained. Room service was on top , as a matter of fact next day morning we left the sign do-not-disturb on the door , and the room attendant saw us leaving and she still managed to enter and clean our suite while we were at the Inter Club Lounge, having free breakfast (as it was included with the Club Room Reservation). This in itself reminded me of a very personal caring and attention, similar to a Hay Adams , in DC where we had a personal attandant for our needs. Ok , soap , shampoo ? No problems . Towels, in the gym ? My partner who speak only english , had to ask the attendant a towel, but he did get it, and he moved on. I do not think that this is worth a comment , sometimes things are in place , you just have to look for it and as long as there is an attendant, as always is, will be solved. Elevators were 2 in operation, of which one was always grounded and ready to be taken for a quick ride up, which I found smart, as we never waited to get to our suite on the 13th floor. On the way down elevators were obviously slower (the price to pay-you don't have to be Einstein to figure it out!!), but was moving well , less that 2 min most of the times, maybe once we waited more than usual and it got busy , I assume a group was checking out , all at the same time, which is an exception to the rest of the times, not realy worth mentioning, it is a hotel , yes.. Overall the cultural events in the happenning like Easter, White Party and the Gaga events, etc ... are all related to the outside world of the hotel, we think Motreal is a very modern and relaxed place to be , never in the hotel we experienced other than quiet and laid-back cosmopolitan atmosphere, from staff and patrons as well, a very relaxing week-end indeed.. I meant to mention one more time that the best surprize was the afternoon access to the Club Inter, where Lea welcomed us to the one of the best buffet with wine degustation that I could not resist, it was as good as we practically skipped dinner Sat nite ( Do not tell this to nobody). In other words the pampering went against our will, and that in itself speaks miles towards the stars credit. (a 6 star service!). Although we were not familiar the Inter Montreal ,we were familiar with the Willard in DC (where we spent Palm Sunday ) and with the Boston Inter. We like them both, but we would thing ( despite the currency exchange rate) the Montreal Inter is the hiden gem!-right now. ( and I am not talking of the Club Inter buffet , that dissapeared in Boston, and Willard DC never had it!). Or maybe I am. Montreal, keep it going! We will be back, hopefuly: talk to you soon Dulce and see you soon Lea. And if not , we will keep wonderful memories on our Sumsung Galaxy Pad Photo Gallery. Now you know who we are : Two very well satisfied Ambassador Club members from New York, de passage..a Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Holiday Inn than an Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: MFabulous
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Montreal often and we normally stay at the Sofitel. We were returning to Montreal for Easter and wanted to try the Intercontinental for a change. We had stayed here 10 years ago when the hotel was newer. We were very disappointed and will not be back. We booked an Iconic Suite which is nice enough but nothing special. Our quoted price included a buffet breakfast. We tried the buffet breakfast for only 1 morning and preferred the smaller buffet in the Club lounge but only on weekends. On weekdays, the Club lounge is full of business travelers looking to get in and out really quickly. The hotel has gone down hill since its opening, regardless of the recent renovation in 2009. Service and staff are very absent. You are asked to request your car from the valet 20 minutes before you need it. We always asked for it 30 minutes prior to retrieving it and were always told by the bellman that no one had requested our car. Turn down service is not given unless you ask for it. Toiletries and amenities in the room are non-existent. We only got 1 mini bottle of shampoo and had to ask for extra every day. When we went to the pool and asked for towels, we were told that they were in short supply and needed to be conserved. That was the most unbelievable -- how is it that a luxury hotel is short on towels? This is unheard of. The common areas are also dirty. There was a Lady Gaga tour group staying at the hotel which made the property feel like roadie central. Pizza delivery guys roamed the hotel freely knocking on wrong doors to deliver pies. There was also a White Party across the street and, in the morning, a lot of ravers were stumbling into the hotel, shirtless and shoeless, to go to their rooms. Breakfast was nothing special. When we checked in, and told that breakfast was included in our rate, we asked if we could get it delivered to our room. We were told absolutely. When we ordered room service the following morning, we were socked with a $90 breakfast bill for eggs, coffee and fruit and told that room service was not part of our rate. I wouldn't mind so much if the breakfast was good, but it was actually pretty bad and not what we ordered either. We felt ripped off. The gym opens at 9am on weekends and closes early. On weekdays, it closes at 7pm. To the devoted work out crowd, this is bad news. All in all, the hotel is skimpy and not what you expect from a property which promises a luxury stay. The Sofitel and St. James in Montreal have this property beat hands down. I will probably never stay in another Intercontinental ever again. Finally, if an Intercontinental manager reads this review and wants to provide the normal "sorry we didn't meet your expectations but you must be difficult" type of reply, I recommend that your time would be better spent on evaluating your property and staff instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a lesiurely weekend in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: bdyrck
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews before we went away, I was a bit concerned. I was very pleasantly surprised once we arrived. We had gotten our room on Hotwire & saved $100 - so check that option out. Our room was on the 22nd floor, facing the Montreal skyline. On a sunny day, we could see as far as the Olympic stadium. The location is great for those seeking some quiet time. The renovations were clearly well done, as the hotel seems ultra modern & chic. It is connected to the underground RES (reseau) - a series of underground walkways. You can virtually get to the orange line metro completely underground, while passing shops & art work. You leave the hotel & are in within Old Montreal within a matter of minutes. It's a very quiet area, which features other hotels (the Westin is right next door) and smaller boutique hotels that are further into Old Montreal. I didn't access the pool or restaurants, so I can't comment on that. There are two resteraunts within the hotel - one being more of a bar, the other called Osco. Also attached to the hotel is a Java U - a trendy coffee shop that offers sandwiches, coffee & other drinks at a reasonable rate. Attached to the exit of the hotel which faces the underground walkways are multitudes of stores, cafes & restaurants - convenient if you want a quick bite (i.e. Sushi Shop). The room itself was very well-appointed. The bathroom had a good deal of space, featuring a tub & shower that were separate from one another. The bedroom area featured a queen-sized bed with comfy linens & feather filled pillows. I can see that if you were staying for longer than 2-3 days, the lack of sitting area in the room could get tiresome. However, I was not on a Club Level floor, so I'm assuming those rooms are bigger. I didn't use the concierge service, but we did stow our bags before we left the city, which was a good feature. Room service prices were typical for a 4 star hotel. If you do wish to order, do so during the day - prices skyrocket on the night menu (i.e. a Caesar salad jumps from $10 to $25!). I also didn't use the parking service, but it was clear there was valet at the street entrance on Saint Antoine. internet was at a fee of $15 a day. We were offered a special for $10 that featured unlimited local calls (which normally cost $1.50 per call) & wireless. Overall, I thought this hotel was great for our needs. I would definitely return in a heartbeat! If you are looking for more of a party atmosphere, I would suggest something else that's closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location, but not without flaws”
Reviews.Author: PassThroughCustoms
Reviews.Content: My son and I were in Montreal for a recent trip to see McGill University and the city. The Intercontinental is located very close to Old Montreal, but is still within walking distance to downtown, shopping, and McGill (if you're willing to walk 30 minutes or so). The hotel is across the street from the Palais des Congres. It is also on the RESO which is worth figuring out if you are in Montreal in inclement weather. The RESO is the "underground city" where commercial buildings and malls are interconnected underground. You can walk out of the rain, snow, and auto traffic over a significant part of downtown Montreal. The concierge was very helpful with how we could walk to McGill from the hotel, avoiding the rain the entire way. The RESO is awesome and the hotel is perfectly situated on it. We self parked for $22 a day rather than valet park. To access the lot, you turn off St. Antoine onto St. Pierre and the garage is immediately on the right. The front desk staff were efficient, and check-in took less than two minutes. The room we had (two double beds) was roomy and the bathroom has a separate bathtub and shower. There was a flat screen TV with a basic selection of channels, many in French. There is a safe in the cabinet which was big enough to store a 15" laptop, a DSLR camera, a few lenses, and more. The internet is pricy at $14.50 a day, but it seemed pretty fast. The pool was OK. It's basically a small lap pool. The fitness center staff provide a towel when you sign in. There is a sauna and a steam room in the change room. We didn't use the rest of the fitness center with the equipment. The location, as I said, is great. You just walk out of the hotel and head down St. Pierre street and you are in Old Montreal. From there, turn left on Notre Dame, and the Basilica is a short stroll down the street. We walked from the hotel to Crescent and Ste. Catherine in about 25 minutes. The walk from the hotel to McGill via the RESO took about 30 minutes, and that included soaking up the sights along the way. Tip for photographers visiting the Notre Dame Basilica - I recommend an ultrawide-angle lens and tripod. I didn't have my tripod, so I was shooting ultrawide at 10mm and ISO 3200 for 1/10 or 1/20 second handheld. A tripod would have been much easier though, and then I could have shot long exposures at f/11 at base ISO. Anyway, back at the hotel, one problem we experienced were the elevators. There are four elevators, but only one appeared to be functioning. What this meant was sometimes long waits for elevators, and sometimes when they eventually arrived, they were totally full. We were only in Montreal for 2 days, but if the trip was longer or if I was on business, the elevators would have been an unnacceptable nuisance. It did not appear anyone was working on them either. The stairs are not a realistic option because the room floors start at floor 10. The other issue that prevents a 5 out of 5 rating are "the little things." When we checked into our room for the first time, there were no facecloths and no soap. A cart with dirty room service stuff on it from a nearby room sat in the hallway for a while one morning (at least several hours). There was a long hair (not mine or my son's) on one of the pillows. The TV remote was disgustingly dirty. Despite the issues above, I would stay at the Intercontinental again. Other than the elevator problem, the minor flaws we noticed are procedural that management should be able to correct through training of the cleaning and room service staff. The elevator problem is also fixable, but it requires the hotel recognizing that they need to spend the requisite money - probably significant - to properly maintain their elevators in working condition.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING IN ALL AREAS”
Reviews.Author: CHIEF9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful long weekend at the Intercontinental in Montreal--we were upgraded to a suite and in turn were afforded access to Club Intercontinental. We met Chistelle in Club Intercontinental and were so impressed with her. She made us feel right at home and was so helpful--she is a remarkable young lady and seems to have knowledge in ALL areas of the hotel. It was a sincere pleasure to have met her and she definately made our stay that much nicer. Overall, a fabulous hotel and the Club Intercontinental was a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Earthcare
Reviews.Content: I was a speaker at a conference and the organisers paid for my room, but the delegates paid $169 per night, which seemed reasonable for the facilities. The restaurant, bar, gym and pool were all fine and perfectly clean, although perhaps smaller than you would expect for a 28 floor hotel. The location is opposite the Palais de Congres conference centre, with an interconnecting tunnel so you donâ€™t have to go outside during bad weather. Itâ€™s also on the old town side making it convenient to explore the old town on foot. However, the lobby floor layout is very counter intuitive and disorientating when entering from street level, and only really works when you enter from the shopping level, but this isnâ€™t signposted so it will take you a few days to find it! The buffet breakfast isnâ€™t worth $30.13, but there are plenty of eateries at shopping level once you learn how to gain access without going outside. Although the room was large, there was only enough hanging and draw space for one occupant. I thought the dÃ©cor was very dated, and the view was really dismal (see photo). Although the staff were friendly and helpful they werenâ€™t particularly efficient. A letter left at reception by a business colleague wasnâ€™t handed to me until I checked out four days later, and despite a fully functioning computer the checkout reception was unable to spot that the room had been prepaid, or to cope with such a difficult checkout without the assistance of a manager! If someone else was paying, I wouldnâ€™t be disappointed if they booked me in here again, but if I was paying Iâ€™d definitely look for something higher up the TripAdvisor rankings â€“ 30 something is probably about the right level for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location - Nice refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: lyonnaisdecoeur
Reviews.Content: Really had a nice stay here recently on a leisure trip. Booked a room at a great value, and was upgraded to a club room as plat ambassador. The hotel is centrally located and the service is excellent. Breakfast was excellent as well. My only complaint was the cleanliness of the pool area - not that the pool was dirty or anything but it was clear that people had been wearing shoes around the pool area, which is annoying when you are bearfoot

Reviews.Title: “Very High Level Insatallations with Medium Level Service”
Reviews.Author: myownopinion
Reviews.Content: Wow, Intercontinental has a lot to offer. It is very well located, the hotel is more than clean. The decoration and amenities are very up to date. The location is merly perfect for all kind of travelers. You can walk everywhere from the hotel. The only negative point is the service. The service (attitude) is well but certainly not as expected from a luxury hotel. The staff is simply not clientele oriented. You won't receive if you don't ask. The staff is not at client's beck and call! I continue to beleive that when you travel and stay in high level Hotels, the only real difference is in the details. Intercontinental is on the way but haven't yet totally understood this major issue. Very good hotel but need serious service improvments.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, clean hotel with helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: lstpeterrdh
Reviews.Content: We were in Montreal to see Bon Jovi at the Bell Centre and booked this hotel using hotwire. I was hoping to be a bit closer to the Bell, but the hotel was beautiful and the staff were very accomodating helping us learn the area. After exploring the underground city and Metro, we decided to take a cab to the event, which was a 5 minute ride and cost less than $10. The only negative was that the location of the hotel was in the financial district and being a weekend, most of the shops and restaurants were closed! We ended up eating at the hotel's restaurant "Osco" which was very nice if a bit pricy. The breakfast buffet included made to order omelets and was excellent for $23 per person. The rooms were very clean and elegant with large marble bathrooms with separate shower. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the business district and the "old city", but not if you want to be near the action of St. Catherine St. and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an Old Montreal weekend getaway...but wouldn't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: wokyan00
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for us as we were in Montreal for just the weekend for a music festival in the Old Port. However, travellers who are looking for be closer to downtown will probably think this location is too far "from the action". We happened to find this hotel on a special rate (through expedia) otherwise, I wouldn't have paid full price for the room. The hotel is rated as a five star but there is nothing overly spectacular about it. The rooms are nice but they don't have some of the basics that you would expect in a five star like coffee maker, tea, toothpaste, better quality shampoo/soap. There is a small swimming pool but no hot tub (after a long day out in the chilly Montreal weather, we were really hoping to relax in a whirlpool but no luck). The hotel staff are not very knowledgeable about restaurants in the area. After asking three staff where to have brunch, we were told to go to Eggspectation (which I have been to in the past and would never recommend to anyone). After walking around for 15min we stumbled upon several cute little bistros. Not sure why no one recommended them in the first place. My biggest complaint about the hotel is that they don't offer free wifi! In this day and age, especially when you have been rated as a five star and are frequented by both leisure and business travellers, free wifi is a service you expect automatically. Instead they were charging a ridiculous $14/day. We asked to extend our check out time on the last day and got different answers from different staff about their late check out policy (some saying 4pm only, some saying 6pm with a $25 charge). We ended up going along with the staff who agreed to extend our check out time with no penalty!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located.. I Love love love for this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jrc3769
Reviews.Content: Traveled from San Diego Here. We truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel while. We stayed 6 days at this hotel and just really fell in love with the location. Then you get inside the room and the chic decor just made our trip worth it. The beds were made everyday and we didn't have to ask for it. The gym, the pool, were adequate but more importantly, clean. A coffee deli is also available and convenient just below the lobby. The lobby is well decorated and comfortable allowing you to hang out and read papers and such (Although I people watched all the time). The best part of this hotel is its close access to the metro subway station, green line, blue lines, all lines. Making it easy to hop and stop to any destination around the Montreal. Of course, Meeting some of the great tennis players was added bonus if you are into tennis. :) Adieu...Happy Trip

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jtreby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a 3 night get away to Montreal. We paid for our room with reward points, but even so, the hotel staff treated us like we were their most important guests. The concierge managed to get us reservations at one of the most popular bistros in the city, the girls at the front desk greeted us each time we passed by and the bar maid in the absinthe bar was enchanting and very eager to educate us in the particulars of absinthe. The hotel restaurant was very, very good (I reviewed it separately). Our room was well appointed, spacious, with a very comfortable bed and good linens. The bathroom was also spacious, with a separate shower and tub. The location was fantastic, right next to the old city and the cathederal and across the street from the convention center. Montreal's underground is easy to navigate and there are plenty of taxi's, so no need to drive. The valets were courteous, as were the bellman, and they were also very good at pointing out some of the city's hidden gems. We had a wonderful, romantic weekend, and the people at this hotel added to that experience. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and room ever!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 09 and received a free upgrade to a larger suite because our room wasn't ready. The concierge was very nice and friendly and we had a great time- only problem was the location. It wasn't bad but not walking distance for shopping, eating or partying.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: lojo34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in Montreal on a combination business/pleasure trip. We very much enjoyed this property. The room was large and very comfortable. I really liked the large shower (separate from the bathtub). The location is very convenient for touring in â€œVieux Montrealâ€� and is also close to the subway for visiting places further away. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast, which was included in the price of our room. We had the choice of a buffet or ordering off the menu. I did find it a little disappointing that internet access was an extra cost, but that was the only drawback of our 3-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MaureenB5
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is so convenient for business in downtown, I love that I can walk to old town in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “just loved it”
Reviews.Author: annemaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: This is my first time at the Intercon Montreal but I will definitely use it again. the rooms are big and have an ipod dock as well as an easy to use coffee machine (it looks like shower system and coffee machines are made not to be used at some hotels, right?). The hotel is spotless and rooms are very quiet. My favourite goes to the restaurant Osco where they have a board of specials, very well executed. I felt special in this restaurant, it is cosy, I could have stayed for longer. Such a missed opportunity for them that the staff is not trying to sell, they do their job very well though but no refill of wine, etc..I would have bought anything though (almost)

Reviews.Title: “Refitted hotel which exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanPete
Reviews.Content: I'm not a great fan of the Intercontinental chain, and so only ended up at the Montreal InterCon as we had a work conference here. Overall, I was really impressed by what they'd done - a special call-out to both the rooms and the staff. The rooms have been recently refitted with a modernist but practical design. Beds are attractive, and it was easy to sleep so long as you ignored the plague of bugs which were bizarrely affecting the outside of the hotel (nothing on the inside). A special call out to the concierge staff, who were perhaps the best I've seen in any hotel. They were able to sort out large restaurant reservations with thoughtful recommendations as well as VIP entrance to local clubs. We had an active social life after the work was done, so the concierge team (at least 2 Clef d'Or among them) really contributed to the positive experience we all had with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: Travel0h0lic
Reviews.Content: The Intercon was totally refurbished in 2009... and it is FABULOUS. I am a frequent traveller to Montreal for business and have stayed in this hotel (as well as several others) a number of times. The NEW look and feel makes the Intercon something special. I really, really liked it. The only negative was that on day 3 my in-room breakfast order was forgotten. No big deal as I know the area and had enough time to catch a coffee and Swiss bagel on my way to my meeting. I'll be staying here the next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Widgerys
Reviews.Content: This Hotel met or exceeded our expectations in every regard! Easy walk to just about everywhere. 1 km East of Bell Center, less than that to Notre Dame Basilica, right on the edge of Old Montreal & right across from Convention Center & Metro access!! No Bedbugs here! Rooms were ultra modern, large & spotless!! Foot switches for floor lamps, proximity room access key cards ( no fumbling to find slot ). Bathroom amazing ( & huge ). Beds extremely comfortable. Other Hotels could learn many lessons from Intercontinental!! Osco Restaurant reaaly nice; but the BEST part was Yvan, the head waiter. He made all of our visits here a terrific experience; explaining everything about the menu ( in english I should add ) & going out of his way to see to it we had everything we could possibly require. When you have travelled as much as we have, it is easy to recognise a stand -out like Yvan & every restaurant should be so lucky as to have someone as dedicated to customer service! TIP!! For 7 dollars, take the 747 express bus to & from the airport ( various stops in Montreal ). Runs every 10 minutes or something like that & is easy to find! Cabs will run you $40.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: vanillaberries
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here for the first night of our honeymoon. (we travelled to Quebec City the next day) We took a red eye flight to Montreal, and arrived at the hotel at 7:30am. We were very tired, and planning to leave our bags at the desk and wander around waiting for check in. But, when we arrived at the front desk, they gave us a free honeymoon upgrade, and checked us in right away!! (what a blessing to be able to have a nap after being awake all night!) Once we had rested, we decided to treat ourselves to the breakfast buffet at the Osco restaurant in the hotel. It was quite pricey... ($23 each) but was the most delicious breakfast buffet I have ever had. Perfect for a special occasion like our honeymoon. All the staff at this hotel were very friendly, and the service was excellent. Very nice rooms. Candy and alcohol provided in the room were quite expensive, but we expected this - so we brought our own!! The location of this hotel was phenomenal, only a couple of blocks from Old Montreal. We will be staying at this hotel every time we travel to Montreal!!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Punjabicutie4u
Reviews.Content: LOVE this hotel, great people working behind the front desk. I went on this vacation with my 3 sisters & we had a blast, Rooms were clean, close by to everything and generally a fun place to hang out. Recommend taking trains around the city, very conveninet and cost effective. Front desk very agreeable w/ giving suggestions & places to eat. Overall great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK - would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TravelCallie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met some friends from Toronto - they had points for this hotel so we wanted to stay at the same hotel. We originally booked for Fri&Sat at a relatively good rate, but later discovered there were packages available with breakfast and parking included so we called and switched - hotel was accommodating. We drove up from the Boston area - looking for that "valet" parking which was not in sight. We parked on the street behind about 10 cars and I walked in looking for someone to help. I waited about 10 minutes to find out you park on the street and drop your key. No help with bags. :( Another issue we had is that our key did not work, so I had to schlepp back downstairs to get new keys. The hotel itself is well located and beautifully appointed. The room was nice - it was a good size, but the window looked directly into another room "Intimate King", so we had to keep the drapes closed. Bathroom was outdated, rusty in spots,terrible tub, backed up, etc. Not what you expect for $250 a nite. Breakfast was OK, not great. Usual buffet. We brought our laptop to research activities but were put off by the $14.50 a day charge to connect. Overall we paid about $552 for 2 nites, parking and breakfast. We would not stay in the hotel again. I think you can find a better hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in montreal”
Reviews.Author: AliceGr
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about the room. I did not find the mattress to be comfortable, but my husband likes very firm mattresses, so he found it to be quite comfortable. This place is LUXURY!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Walking”
Reviews.Author: urbanagrl
Reviews.Content: Great location near Old Montreal, walked everywhere down to there, and their "Metro" is not too far away and is easily negotiable- comparable to that of DC if you are familiar with it. Hotel is nice- clean, comfortable, quiet, and check in and out was a breeze. Didn't eat there, but did enjoy the coffee shop at the bottom, great place to people watch in the window. There were several other good breakfast locations located on the same street toward Old Montreal. Dinner choices in the area were abundant- again, we did it in Old Montreal, not the hotel. When we moved something in the mini bar and had a charge for looking they immediately took it off when we called down- it measured weight/movement. Got great deal on Hotwire and weren't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location. Spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: vacationlove
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Great deal from priceline bid your own price. 2. Perfect location. Walkable to Old Montreal, Downtown, Chinatown, and St. Laurent strip. 3. Very spacious rooms. 4. Street parking. 5. Very close to Toque. (Must go to this restaurant! Excellent food and staff! Very enjoyable experience!) Cons: 1. Lady at check in did not have a pleasant attitude. Asked for a king size bed, but she was not helpful in accommodating us. Did not offer for us to switch rooms the next day. She just said no we are full. She was not very friendly, no smiles, did not say thank you or enjoy your stay to us. During our check out, we overheard another customer having problems with the same lady. 2. Found a hair on one of the pillows, Since we had 2 beds, we just slept on the other one. 3. Expensive valet parking. We just parked in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, elegantly comfortable, blissful restaurant, pricey.”
Reviews.Author: eagle22
Reviews.Content: Booked six nights at a discounted rate on the internet. The room was spendid-on the 20th floor looking out over Mont Real and the city...ever changing vistas, sun setting on skyscrapers, fountain in leafy square below. Big marble bathroom with bath, separate shower, quallity toiletries, loads of fresh towels. Huge bed, huge TV (shame content so dull, but city makes up for it.) Very quiet-no noise at all from other rooms. I ate out for breakfast, but had 4 of 6 suppers in Oscis-onsite restaurant-pricey (but so seemed to be many evening eateries), but blissful-surroundings, food, wine, service. Spa is really just a saltwater pool and gym-basic, but fine for swimming lengths to work off the calories. Staff more reserved than US hotels, but if you ask, very obliging and helpful. One evening restaurant was very busy and food slow-without me saying anything they gave me a free glass of wine as apology. location ideal for conference centre, old town and access to Metro via underground city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicoler
Reviews.Content: Loved the design of the building and the interior spaces. This is in a great location and you can easily access Old Montreal. The hotel staff was very accommodating and everyone spoke French and English fluently. The bar was fun, the pool small but elegant, and the concierge on duty was always very helpful. Very good value and elegant modern style.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but nothing is included”
Reviews.Author: mcneicerachel
Reviews.Content: Watch out for extra charges that are ridiculously priced. No breakfast, REALLY high wi-fi rates, don't touch the mini-bar. Great location, especially for business. Gym is ok, not enough equipment or space. Good pool. Rooms are luxurious. Concierge and staff were EXCELLENT. Overall, nice hotel, but I wouldn't stay there if it weren't on business.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: mollybecky
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days this time--last visit to this hotel was ten years ago. We had a club room with a corner view. The hotel is nictheely updated and trendy with contemporary decor, and the club lounge is beautifully decorated. They have a very nice breakfast and happy hour, even better than most Intercontinental hotels (and they are of good quality). Rooms are of decent size, and the bathrooms are large and elegant. It's in a nice location--in Vieux Montreal and connected to the Metro station. You're very close to downtown--and it's easy to get around. You can pretty much shop and dine in Montreal without going outdoors--very useful in the winter! We will plan to stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location next to Vieux Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: MANYFLCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this InterContinental over Labor Day weekend. The hotel was very busy, as was Vieux Montreal (we could not get a room in Vieux Montreal). The concierge was extremely helpful - we took at least four of their specific suggestions (places to see, restaurants, etc) and would go back to each. The rooms are beautifully and tastefully done and ours was impeccably clean (knowing InterContinentals I'd have to think the previous reviewer's experience with a non-clean room was an exception). Bathrooms are beautiful, large and have all the extras (phone, tv speaker, bath scale, separate shower and tub and extra personal care accoutrements). We did not eat at the restaurant (too many incredible culinary experiences closeby in Vieux Montreal) but heard from other guests that it was very good. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but.... need staff management !!!”
Reviews.Author: NRRobinson
Reviews.Content: We leave in Montreal but we like beeing tourists in our own town ! So we were at the InterContinental hotel for my friend's birthday night last week (sept.07, 2010) on a Tuesday night. I had booked a corner room for around 200$ CND. The good - Nice location -Nice lobby. -Nice, good looking and large room and bathroom. -Very nice view of the city (depending on the floor level !). -Very confo bed. -Lot of free parking around after 6:00pm. The bad Check-In: - When we arrived at front desk for the check in they did not offer us an room upgrade as we usually received as Priority club Platinium member - not even a small gift like a chocolate or free drink at the bar ! Platinium member or not - it seems there is no benefit at this hotel !!! - I was requested a room with a view. When we arrived at the room we remarked that we have the view of the roof of the others hotels around !!! Back to front desk and asked for another "view". The new one was ok. - The cleaning level of the room was not as expected !!! Very borderline: stain glass on the desk and lot of fingerprints on the TV (which was nice by the way) - No bathrobe - usually there is always 2 robes in our last Intercontinental hotels. Check-out - They try to charge us for the Internet access when we did not have a computer with us. I refused to pay and they did not charge it . I have seen other reviews with this exact same issue of overcharge problem... I don't understand why it is still happen ! - When we live the hotel after the check-out it was raining cats and dogs. The doorman (i can not call this indiferent giuy as a concierge !) was there and was talking with an other hotel's employee. I asked if it is possible to have an umbrella that I can use to be able to get in the car without beeing completly soaked. That young guy was looking at me like I was requested a travel to Mars !!! He seems having no idea of the work of a concierge and the importance of it role at the guests' departure !!! Very bad attitide !!! So this hotel is nice by itself but can be nicer with a better staff management !

Reviews.Title: “Anytime I'll need to return to Montreal, this is where I want to stay.”
Reviews.Author: donna4780
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, you end up in cities that have so much to offer but never the time to enjoy it. So, when it comes to having a good meal, I seek out the help of the concierge. My colleagues & I needed restaurant recommendations and each night of the week, Shantal and Sandy were so nice and so accomodating. Her recommendations were always on par and her follow up ended with pleasant conversation. Anytime I'll need to return to Montreal, this is where I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good - with a few small complaints”
Reviews.Author: Bjmcisaac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for an anniversary trip - 2 nights (Saturday, September 4 to Monday, September 6) then off to a different part of the city. I am a gold ambassador who had not stayed at this hotel before (I stay regularly at the two Intercontinentals in Toronto for both business and leisure). I booked our stay using an (old version) ambassador weekend certificate. We booked a "For Foodies Package" which was supposed to include a "Deluxe Irresistible 1 King Bed" Room, a full buffet breakfast for both of us each day at Osco (the hotel restaurant), free internet, two free cocktails at the hotel bar (Absinthe) and a "foodies package restaurant coupon booklet" which included (as you may have guessed) restaurant discounts and 4 metro bus or subway tickets. We arrived early and left our bags with the bellman/valet and wandered the city. When we came back at 4 p.m. to check-in there was a wedding party entering the hotel (which, someone told us, was an Alouette football player's wedding) and a huge crowd of pre-teen girls waiting outside (who we later found out were waiting for the Jonas Brothers, who were staying at the hotel). It all made for a very crowded entryway and lobby reception. As mentioned, the lobby was very crowded and the line for check-in quite long. When I finally made it to the reception desk (we didn't see an ambassador check-in area at all during the weekend) the young man informed me that we had been upgraded to a "tourelle suite" (corner suite on the turret side of the hotel, facing the city) but that the room wasn't ready (which it was supposed to be) and he asked me to come back in 45 minutes. We went and had a coffee in the attached "Java" coffee house and came back up 50 minutes later. When I made it back to reception, I was informed that my room still wasn't ready. He offered me another "Inspiring" corner room on a club floor but, as we already had breakfast and a couple drinks included with our package and wanted a suite, we declined and offered to wait until the tourelle suite was ready. He called housekeeping and they told him it would be ready in half an hour. We decided to grab a drink in the bar (Absinthe). We both really liked the bar atmosphere and the servers were great. My wife really liked the absinthe cocktails (we came back for a couple more drinks during our stay). 45 minutes later, I wandered back out to the reception desk - by this time there was a huge crowd of people in the lobby waiting for their rooms to be ready. I got a young, dark-haired lady this time and she apologized but said the room still wasn't ready. She too called up to housekeeping, and was told they were in the room cleaning and would be done in 20 minutes. She apologized again, and gave me a couple of free drinks at the bar, which we enjoyed. When I came back, the room was finally ready. However, I was not offered the drink tickets, breakfast vouchers or any of the other things included in my package. I asked for them and she seemed perplexed so I pulled out my blackberry and showed her the reservation and the things included. She did not seem to have heard of the package before, but quickly gave me two drink tickets, and four breakfast vouchers. She had no idea what the coupon booklet was and had no metro passes, so we decided to head up to our room without them as all of the hotel staff were presently occupied. My gift once arrived during turndown service (this time with three dark chocolate and three white chocolate/coconut truffles). My wife thought these were very good (I am not a big chocolate lover - but she sure is!). The room was great, large bedroom with door, very large sitting area with a couch, desk and two armchairs with ottomans and coffee table, and a great view of the city. We enjoyed our two buffet breakfasts at Osco - the food selection was quite good and they had an omelet/scrambled egg station that provided made-to-order goodness.
