Service in the restaurant was good, but they were very busy on the Monday and seemed understaffed as the two waiters couldn't clean the tables fast enough to prevent a large line from growing even though there were many empty tables. On the last day we decided to wander around some more and take advantage of our 4 p.m. checkout. When we arrived back to the room at 2 p.m., our keycards did not work so we went down to reception. They had been deactivated as it was past normal checkout (but not ambassador late-checkout). He reactivated one card so we could get back in the room to get our belongings (he originally offered to take us up without giving us a card, which I declined). I had not been given a copy of my bill to this point (at all of the other Intercontinental's I had stayed at, one had always been slid under the door before I got up the last day) so I asked for one and we went up to the room. I noticed that we had been charged for internet each day (included in our package) and for local calls. When I checked out I mentioned this and they were promptly removed, with apologies. Other notes - I did not receive my paper on the Monday, even though I was asked if I wanted one. They did provide them on each floor next to the elevators, so I grabbed one from there. I also never received my coupon book or metro tickets. Despite a few snafus, we honestly did enjoy our stay and the hotel. In particular, the upgrades, provision of ambassador benefits on a reward night, the bar and the breakfast at Osco were all great. We also were impressed with the young, female concierge, who provided impeccible service. However, we were disappointed with check-in, being "locked" out of our room with our belongings still in there, and the incorrect charges to our bill. All in all, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the Old City”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan6
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern hotel near the Old City, the Intercontinental would be a good choice. The room was very nice, and the bed was great. The only quibble would be with Housekeeping, who missed out on several details during our stay (did not replace used glassware, but did replace towels even though they were hung up per their "green" policy, etc). The reason to stay here, however, is location - less than 5 minute walk to the old city, and also connected to 2 Metro stations via underground - helpful when the weather is questionable). The bar was overpriced, though it also closed for renovation during our stay and may be different - did not eat in the restaurant. Charge for WiFi, of course... Parking was not cheap - though we parked ourselves as we knew we would be walking or taking the Metro throughout our visit, and there is a charge every time you go in/out unless you Valet. We actually might have used the Valet but there was no one there to take the car at our arrival and we were not about to wait...

Reviews.Title: “Gross, dirty, rundown, and terrible, ignorant service”
Reviews.Author: jsimps15
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really as bad as I'm saying it is. It started when we arrived at 2:00 pm to check in and the lobby had a line of probably 25 people waiting for their room. I wasn't given my room until 6:00 pm and was told I could wait in the lobby. Upon entry to my room the first thing was the awful smell of smoke. Second was the dirty floor. Third was the eye lashes and wet floor in the bathroom from the previous guests I presume. An unclean toilet. And internet that just didn't work. In trying to fix these problems, the staff was borderline useless. Very friendly, but after speaking with the manager, I still waited for over 3 hours to get my room cleaned. The response I received from the front desk worker when I asked about having the internet looked at was: "That's no problem sir, here is a telephone number of the company the does the internet, it's nothing to do with us." I can't believe these people. At 5:00 am the in room alarm clock started buzzing and I spent a few minutes trying to figure out how to shut it off before I ripped it from the wall and tossed it on the floor. I've heard that they have considerably downsized the amount of cleaning staff at this hotel and it shows painfully. They're almost not even cleaning the rooms and the staff is in general terrible and helping you out. Needless to say I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely satisfied with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eddefort
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the week and we were very pleased with the: 1. Breakfast and Dinner/Bar Hospitality Room (which is a priority club perk), 2. the very friendly/courteous staff, and 3. the fabulous location. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to feel pampered. Additionally, I enjoyed the gym/sauna. The gym has a nice pool... but it is on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “location, location and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: MarylandDani
Reviews.Content: We had a very good rate and a very large room. There is a coffee maker in the room, no other amenities. The room was DARK at night. Their "business center" is a computer and printer/fax in a corner next to the concierge. Passwords were necessary to log in but nobody around to help you most of the time. The concierge was rather indifferent to the whole thing. They charge a fortune for copies and faxing. The parking is not very convenient, since the street is always congested. The Westin next door has its own driveway. The only good option if you plan to use the car is valet parking, over $30 a night. To check in you need to take the escalator up to the second floor. Having said all that, the hotel is a couple of blocks from the nicest area of Montreal, near shopping, restaurants and the river front. It is a large hotel in an area where you find mostly small boutique hotels or bed and breakfast places. I found the hotel to be rather average in general, and the service unimpressive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: julsblas
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were extremely happy with this hotel from start to finish. The valet car service & bellmen were efficient, always friendly and helpful. The concierge recommended a perfect place for dinner and drinks around the corner with exactly what we requested. The room was large, however the bed was utterly fantastic & luxurious. I usually never sleep well in hotels, however this one was sooo comfortable, very quiet, and perfectly climate controlled. The rooftop terrace and pool came in handy when we need to wait for check (as we arrived early).. The frount desk check in was smooth and, for the most part, had smiling friendly staff. Perfect location with many options for breakfast to dinner, and fun. & old Montreal is just a beautiful place to be! ..We'd stay there again in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Trev81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, the hotel is in a great location. Check-in time on our Itinerary said 3PM but when we arrived we were told check-in is only from 4PM. We paid extra when booking for breakfast, the hotel said breakfast was not included I showed them my Itinerary which states "Included: Full Breakfast" they apologized and then said its only for 2 people. We were a group of 4. Again no where does it say breakfast was only for 2 people, after complaining and multiple trips from the reception lady to management we were given extra vouchers for breakfast. Breakfast was however very nice. Our booking was for four people but this wasn't coordinated with housekeeping as we only had 2 sets of everything. The bed was small. Be careful when looking at things in the mini-bar it's automated and when you remove something for looking at, it's charged to your account. Self Parking is ridicules, its not a set daily charge and not affiliated with the hotel you pay every time you drive out, which ends up costing a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but we expected more from an Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Bondsammax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Montreal Intercontinental at the end of July. We had stayed there the previous July and we had some issues which we ignored as the hotel was in the midst of a remodeling that visit. This time we were less forgiving. I am Intercontinental Platinum member so I should be offered a nice room. We were initially put on the lowest (10th) floor of the hotel in a corner room (corner is normally an upgrade) but because it was so low it was surrounded by other buildings and felt like a cave. When we questioned the front desk about the room the manager Simon Martin moved us to the same room but on the 20th floor. I suggested that we should have been put there initially. I also found it curious that there was only 1 bathrobe. Mr. Martin initially said that a single robe was Intercontinental policy. After I assured him that there were 2 robes in our last 2 Intercontinental hotels (also reviewed here & given 5 start ratings) he then said because the hotel was mostly for business people they only gave 1 robe. He agreed that having 2 robes in the room made sense. The room itself was okay, but not as nice as I expect from an Intercontinental. We purchased the room with breakfast buffet option. Breakfast was fine but the food items were refreshed slowly and were usually cold. The restaurant staff were however pleasant. The location near old Montreal is terrific. It is a 10 min to the center of the old area and convenient to restaurants. The hotel atmosphere and service did not have the elegance we expect from an Intercontinental. There is a Westin next door and an Embassy Suites just down the block & we will try one of them next time.

Reviews.Title: “Can be better”
Reviews.Author: Demanet-f
Reviews.Content: First off I'll say that this is a nice hotel in a good location with mostly pleasant staff. Great location, near metro station, great restaurant, very nice breakfast. I just was angry with the welcome staff. At the reception I could not believe it but no one even offered to help us with taking our luggage up to our room!!! We had just arrived off a very long flight and were wrecked but he just watched us haul everything ourselves as they chatted at the front desk!!! Thatâ€™s the first time I had so a bad check-in, no hotel information, no help, no smile â€¦â€¦. Perhaps a realy bad day for the receptionist..... The hotel has its good points certainly but having a personal touch and some feeling of caring are also key. Mr & Mrs Demanet Check-in 07/27/10

Reviews.Title: “Great Summer Stay at the Intercontinental Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kahulaz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful three night stay at the Intercontinental Montreal. Room 2320 is a "super quiet" corner room with windows on two walls and a partial view of the water. Impressed with the comfortable king size bed, quality bed linens and the extra large plush bath towels. Room included a flat-screen TV, Keuring coffee/tea maker, hair dryer, robes and iron. Housekeeping staff and Concierge Sandy were excellent! Sandy's suggestions and recommendations were perfect! Make sure to visit the Marche Jean Tallon (2nd largest market in N. America) for fresh produce, cheese, bread, fish and meats. Freshest and sweetest corn on the cob!! Take Metro - Orange Line to the Jean Tallon Metro stop. Three minute walk from Metro station to the market. Visit Crepe Suzzette (3 St-Paul St E) for outstanding crepes and fondues. We shared the "La Symphonie" dessert crepe (fresh fruit with vanilla custard sauce). 14$ CAD crepe ... Worth every cent. Great site to "people watch". From YUL airport, take 747 Express bus (7$ CAD one-way) to the Intercontinental Montreal. Taxi fare is 38$ CAD. Purchase Bus pass from kiosk outside of baggage area or pay bus driver (Canadian Coins Only NO paper money or US dollars). Hotel is 1/2 block from Old Montreal and 2-3 blocks from Notre Dame. Hotel management needs to improve the guest check-in/check-out experience.

Reviews.Title: “room is well-designed but cleaning level is poor”
Reviews.Author: natsukko
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and during 4 days, no one time, bath tub was cleaned. they probably just have a look and change towels, but not to check if bath was used or not. I was so surprized to see the poor level of bath room cleaning. Room carpet was vacuumed so it was OK. For me, cleaning of room is very important. I understand it is in the middle of summer vacation and probably staffs are taking vacation, I could never imagined inter-continental hotel does not provide proper inspection nor trainning for cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad about the service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelfor4orMore
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room with 2 doubles, on the 22nd floor with a lovely view of the park with the fountain of fire. Room was spacious with a large bathroom. Loved the separate shower and bath. Note it was not a spa bath just your basic tub. Â Clean, well maintained, modern decor and the hotel is conveniently located. While I am trying to be objective, our experience was marred by the staff. From the first impression to the final check out the service was lacking. When we arrived, with two children and 4 pieces of large luggage, the bellman made no offer of assistance just a rushed direction to the check in desk up an escalator-no elevator. The concierge was abrupt and rude, and the checkout - well, let me leave it at frustrating. No offer of assistance either with luggage down the escalator again, until I specifically asked for some kind of assistance. A general lack of friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !!”
Reviews.Author: MrthomasMrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic weekend recently and loved it. It really is the perfect place to stay in Montreal. We had a fabulous room, with a view over the park. The service was outstanding. The room was large and well furnished. The only negative in this hotel is the spa could be a bit larger. The hotel itself was extremely clean and the staff were very helpful, particularly Guy who spent a significant amount of time with us showing us where to go and how to get there. Thanks to him !!! I can only say, if you're going to Montreal - stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel near old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: raneflight
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 night for Canada's Day. We arrived late night and the check-in went smoothly. We were on the 11th floor but our view from the window is not that great... The room was rather large with a desk, big screen tv and very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom is large and has a separate bathtube and shower. The place is very clean and roomy. The location of the hotel is great. It's close to the Square Victoria metro stop as well as Chinatown and old Montreal. It's about a 10min walk to rue St. Catherine and 20min to McGill/Mont Royal. Overall this place is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jsdadinsd
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews and was a little concerned about staying at this hotel based on the negative ones, boy were they wrong. From my wonderful reservation experience with Diane who went out of her way to assist me with my reservation (always call the hotel directly and ask for her), to my positive and friendly interaction with the Manager on site (I believe his name was Oliver), to the very friendly and helpful support staff, this hotel was top notch. Having traveled frequently for work and pleasure, domestically and internationally I have stayed in all types of accommodations and this hotel has to rank in the top 5. It's in a great location right on the border of Old Montreal and a 5 minute walk to Notre Dame (must see and yes pay the $5 and go inside), there are wonderful restaurants very close by (I recommend Accords), it's in a safe area and the people we met were very friendly. The metro and underground "city" are steps away and if you are bored the concierge will provide several options for fun and exciting things to do while in the city. You do not need a car so save your dollars to spend having fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant!!!”
Reviews.Author: vireshjain
Reviews.Content: Amazing Location well connected to the underground. Large Rooms and a excellant restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “ignorance of staff left a foul aftertaste”
Reviews.Author: not_pleased_withIHC
Reviews.Content: Although the room was quint and the breakfast was nice, I have been waiting on a response to a simple complaint for over two months. In a rush to check out, the front desk had made us wait over 30 minutes for a maid to check the mini bar and make sure the room was in order. After rushing to get a taxi, I realized that I left my laptop charger on the desk. I called the hotel immediately, and they said it was waiting at the front desk for me to pick up. The next day when I went to pick it up the staff had no idea what I was talking about, basically called me a liar and then said someone would have to get back to me. How convenient that they took 30 minutes to scan my room before I could check out and no one noticed it until I left the hotel, then it magically disappears. Then no one has the decency to even follow up with a "sorry we didn't find anything". Even though the stay was nice, I will not be using this hotel for business or leisure in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel at the Forefront of all Others!”
Reviews.Author: C0ldCanuck
Reviews.Content: Not knowing what to expect, we were pleasantly surprised when we entered our room. The room has many upgrades/amenities that we have never seen before (ie scale, Keurig coffee maker, phone in bathroom, separate shower and bath tub, etc) plus a huge luxurious bathroom. We appreciated that the room did not have the old clunky and noisy under window register heating/cooling units that most hotels have but a central air unit instead. The hotel is at a great location in Old Montreal - walking distance to all the sights there. Two out of the three staff we interacted with were exceptional. This is now our preferred place to stay in Montreal and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Incroyable! J'adore InterContinental Montreal”
Reviews.Author: astroboy82
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at some very nice hotels in London and Paris, but the InterContinental Montreal is by far more stunning on the inside. Our king-size bedroom was breathtakingly large. We were giddy with delight. I could have done 3 cartwheels! The view wasn't great, but we didn't care. Check-in/out was prompt and concierge service was friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned to the T. The maid stacked our travel brochures and replenished the bath products every day. There's the Java Cafe conveniently located in the lobby that sells delicious breakfast eats, and it's affordable. Just steps away from Old Montreal and the Metro station, I couldn't be happier with this hotel. It made for a wonderful and enjoyable weekend in La Belle Province.

Reviews.Title: “A letdown in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ABinTO
Reviews.Content: Having had great experiences at other InterContinentals, this one was a disappointment. Check-in was efficient enough but overall the staff were indifferent at best. The worst were the wait and bar staff at the lobby bar (Sarah B. Bar?) who ignored many of the patrons while chatting to their regulars at the bar. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Rissa0401
Reviews.Content: From check in, throughout our stay and check out , hotel intercon's staff and services were dissapointing as compared to other hotels i have stayed at in the city which i also paid less for. First, the directions to the parking were not clear and was confusing, the two rooms we reserved under choice privilege membership were given away and were given one one bed versus two which did not fit the 3 people sharing the room. With that inconvenence, staff was rude when bringing us a cot to rectify their mistakes and appeared exasperated because they had to accomodate for this. They offered to "upgrade " us the next day which was really the original reservations which was for two double beds and offered a late check out for 1pm. However, with choice privlege membership who automatically get 2pm check out. When transferring out luggae from the first to second room, the bell boy was making fun of us and how ridiculous that we have so many bags with us, he thought it was so funny he HAD to take a picture on his phone - very unprofessional. When we got our new room, they did not bring out luggage, we had to request it. Upon recieving it, we found that one of our friends chanel perfume was missing and that it appeared it had broke and spilled all over items in a bag. The weird part was that the perfum was gone and that they chagned the bag but they did not bother tell us that it had broke!! When calling concierge, they then acknoweldge that the perfrume bottle broke and offered to replace it. But .. should they of told us at that the time they brought the bags? There was only one positive thing that did happen was that a special request that was set up 3 weeks ago - balloons and a slice of cake was brought to the room.However, that was with a reminder call two hours before. Overall, they were disorganized and not as efficient as other hotels are, especially at their acclaimed level of service. I would rather stay at the Delta down the street or the Holiday Inn in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel & good bar”
Reviews.Author: cheshiremackat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a long weekend. We were in town for a sporting event, and many people were also in the city for the same event - while the hotel was fully booked, it wasn't crowded. The room was on the 11th floor very clean and well appointed. Big LCD TV, *very* comfortable bed. The room had both a shower stall and a bathtub. The tub was small (not a "soaker" tub). The room had a small mini bar, with ridiculous prices ($8.50 for a bottle of water!). There was also a "sexual" amenity kit - the first time seeing that in a hotel - but it is Montreal. The room also featured Elemis amenities in the bathroom - a nice touch. The location of the hotel is excellent! Very close to Old Montreal, but also the Bell Centre and the biz district. The best part of the hotel is the bar off the lobby. The bar features Absinthe in many drinks - which is quite unique. The bar also features some nice tapas. The hotel also had an extensive (and expensive) room service menu. Two small issues with this hotel. 1- The entrance is difficult to find... there is a non-descript door, then a left turn, then an escalator and FINALLY the lobby.... odd, not the worst, but it took me a few minutes to find. 2- Check-out. Unlike any hotel I have stayed in the last 15 years, this hotel didn't provide a bill under the door... you have to line up on the day of departure to clear your bill. On the upside, checkout is noon, which is nice for a little sleeping in. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: Super location, close to both downtown and old Montreal. Front desk staff were very friendly and efficient, doorman was friendly however had to wait on several occasions to find him to get our car, probably not a long time (maybe 5 minutes) however when trying to get to appointments seems like an eternity. The guestroom have been recently renovated with nice carpeting, furniture and lines. The bathrooms seemed a bit dated (small showers) and marble that did not blend well with the newer decor. We did not have time to dine (just 1 night at the property) at the hotel however did have a cocktail in the bar which is nice, the bartender (lady) was a little grouchy. Overall a good upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Check your BILL!!! Major Frauds”
Reviews.Author: Checkyourbill
Reviews.Content: Basically I had rented a room for a friend of mine who was staying in Montreal for the weekend. I had specifically told the Desk Clerk to charge my card ONLY for the room and that everything extra (snacks, room service etc) would be taken care of by my friend upon his check out. Now looking over my card statement I noticed that : 1) They charged the room higher than what was indicated on my invoice 2) They STILL charged the extra snacks and beverage fees on my card after asking them no to. 3) And they also added another 250$ which I have no clue what this amount is supposed to represent? This hotel is nice since they re-modernized in 2009 but as you can see service sucks and they are major frauds when it comes to billing clients!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JC_BOSTON89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. It's definitely an upscale hotel and the rooms and service showed that. It has a great location within walking distance to downtown Montreal and Old Montreal. The only complaint I have is that the pool and sauna&steam room had odd hours. Besides that everything was great. I had breakfast at the hotel every morning and the omelettes were delicious. Sarah B's bar was pricey but worth it. The room was huge and very clean. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in downtown montreal”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: Wow. I don't know where to start. First off it seems the bar is VERY high in Montreal. Every hotel I stayed in here has been great. But this place is fantastic and I only paid $120 a night (through hotwire) !! When I saw that the bathroom had a separate shower AND shower gel I knew I was going to like the Hotel. Most Hotels never have Shower gel. The decor is very stylish and clearly it has been completely modernized recently. The room is stunning and spacious. Very functional as well. The reception super friendly and the gym very well equipped and with new equipment. Location great...just a short walk to old Montreal and downtown. I didn't eat here, but I bet the food is great. I rang down for a toothbrush this morning and they sent one up..and instead of the normal tiny, crappy brush it was a pretty decent sized regular brush. With hotels it's all about the extra touches and this place scores top all around. And for $120 a night...either the Hotel trade is really suffering in Montreal, these guys are about to go bust or they are insane. I would normally pay $300+ for this quality back home in the US. I'm going to see if I can steal some of the very funky lamps in the bedroom...they would look great in my family room ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations in an updated room”
Reviews.Author: Toptraveller4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the business area of Montreal with a short walk to Old Montreal and a little bit further to shopping on Saint Catherine St. They recently renovated the lobby and rooms and so I'll attach some updated photos. The check in went very smoothly and the woman at the desk was pleasantly friendly. We made our way up to the 22nd floor (the rooms are above the 10 office floors so they must all have a pretty good view). The hallways are a bit too dark but our room had a large window facing the harbour, very spacious and nicely decorated. The bathroom has not been updated and had white and green marble, maybe the wallpaper was new but the light switches were older and one of the wall light scones needed repair as did the audio controls because the sound was of very poor quality in the bathroom. There were 2 double beds which gave the room more walking space but queen beds would have been better for our family of 3. Being a business hotel, I'm sure that this superior room would usually be used by only one person so I can understand their choice of bed size. The concierge was very friendly and helped us make the right choice for a restaurant nearby (Beaver Hall). We quite enjoyed our short stay here.

Reviews.Title: “High-end business-class hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: steptravel
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights with husband. Upon early arrival, due to early flight, they were kind enough to find a room for us and let us check in. Concierge gave us excellent map of city and some suggestions for sightseeing. Room very comfortable with nice TV (speakers in bathroom nice touch) and good bedding. Used fitness center sauna and pool, which was relaxing after long day sightseeing. No problems, highly recommend this hotel. Also, ideal location for everything, 5-minute walk from Notre Dame and connected directly to underground city/subway, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here for 4 nights, the hotel is in great shape in a very good location easy to downtown shopping and old Montreal as well as the metro. Front desk staff were very friendly, I arrived at 8am from flying all night and was happily surprised that there was no issue with checking in so early. I had reserved a standard room but was informed upon check in that I had been upgraded to a Junior suite on the club floor. the Room was very large and clean with a separate bedroom with a large flat screen tv, the living room had two wing chairs as well as a large sofa and end tables with 4 large windows around the room. The club lounge was also excellent with good quality tapas and assorted beverages. Pool and sauna areas were well maintained and very nice. One of the best hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, brunch poorly organized, pool is odd, womens sauna not hot”
Reviews.Author: jeanlf
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Saturday before Valentine's day, and the hotel was full. Checking in there was a line so the concierge brought around a tray with perrier, sodas, etc. A very nice and apprceciated touch. The line moved quite quickly. We were in a club-class room which was large and lovely, well appointed, large TV. The pool, however, is odd: 41/2 feet deep through-out, barely wide enough for two people to pass doing laps, and entry and exit only by ladders, no stairs. Fine for adults, not OK for children. Maximum guests allowed = 10, just to give you an idea of the size... After not finding the pool very relaxing, I decided to try the sauna in the women's locker room. Unfortunately, I could not get it to warm up to what even felt like 38C (100 F), even after 15 minutes.. I then decided to go back to the room to take a hot and relaxing bath. The bathroom is very large and lovely, but it has a tiny tub that I had to rollover in just to get my stomache wet. Dinner was good but they do not appear to have enough staff working so there were some waits. Also not much duck in my duck risotto. Brunch was the real problem, however, with no plates available, not enough food, long waits for things to be refilled and a general confusion from the staff about what the breakfast included with our hotel package actually entitled us to. One said it included the full "brunch", another said no just the "buffet" breakfast, yet another said it was only for a continental buffet, etc. All of this even though the coupon said "Full Buffet Breakfast". The staff were quite helpful however, and the main problem just appeared to be that there were not enough of them.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this hotel nor in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Pokemon_Tokyo
Reviews.Content: Never trust th hotel staff. When you check in, the clark will give you the card keys to your room that do not work. Air conditioning will cool down somehow automatically (which caused me catching a cold). In checking out, you will find out that snacks that you haven't eaten are charged to your room. Even if you claim you didn't eat them, the hotel clark will tell you in French accent as if you are cheating. Then he will speak with his colleague in French quietly and give you (surprisingly) the same amount of bill with a slightly different content.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DorukK
Reviews.Content: Very great hotel, close to old and new Montreal. Great view of harbor from the room

Reviews.Title: “a terrific hotel, phenomenal staff and superb food”
Reviews.Author: arctic09
Reviews.Content: The staff all deserve huge raises... delightful gal at the front desk (wears glasses)- incredibly warm and charming 3 men in the restaurant - warm, quick and delightful the man who was in the concierge office was superb too the guys on the bottom floor- one was suppose to bring me flowers, we joked, - spectacular people....so natural, helpful and extremely friendly.....whoever hired then deserves another raise!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and close to Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mimikaayu
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Fairmont Montreal but I would say this is better than Fairmont. The hotel is newly renovated so the rooms are clean and spacious. Service is great. The hotel has a nice gym and dry sauna which I really enjoyed. The restaurant is very good. It is very close to Old Montreal though a bit far from St Catherine where all the action are. Old Montreal is good if you come during the summer, there are lots of festival and restaurants opened. Otherwise if you come during fall/winter, the place is pretty dead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virtual_Ted
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great area in old montreal close to all the superb restaurants and nightlife. The hotel has great decor and the conceirge was very helpful with recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “the Best Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: bargirlcliftonparkny
Reviews.Content: For years I have stayed at The Intercontinental and I have never been disappointed! The staff is exceptionallt helpful and friendly! The doormen are fantastic and welcome you like you are a real friend!! George is the perfect doorman I have ever encountered in my travels! My parents went to Montreal often and Got to know the staff pretty well! My Mom passed away last year and I could not believe my eyes when George showed up at the service!!! Absolutely incredible and something my family will never forget!!! The food is excellent, right down to the oatmeal in the morning to the filet mignon melting in your mouth at dinner!!! I have stayed at the top Hotels in Montreal but none compare to my favorite, The Intercontinental!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel spoiled by pointless hidden costs!”
Reviews.Author: Manatus
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Intercontinental was somewhat polarized. On the one hand, both the hotel and the service were excellent: comfortable rooms, well-decorated, clean and with good facilities, great location (close to downtown, the Metro and the old city) helpful staff â€“ especially Gerry the concierge, who had a wealth of knowledge and always had time to share it, his help definitely added a lot to our Montreal experience. All of this definitely deserved the high ratings and reviews. On the other hand, the hotel's policies really hampered our stay, with the â€œnickel and dimingâ€�: Internet, $15 a day (or $8 for 2 hours, there are Internet shops that make all their money from Internet services that charge less than that); Early check-in (if available), $25; Late check-out (even just a half-hour), another $25; Breakfast starts at $20 for juice, coffee and two pastries; Room service, additional fee, etc etc. It really felt like every request we had incurred an extra fee, which is absolutely not what a top-class hotel should feel like. I mean, if you were spending one night for a meeting in Montreal and your flights meant that you had to check in before 4pm and leave after noon, that's $50 extra right there, just for absolutely standard services that every other hotel (even the Holiday Inn Express brand in the same chain) is happy to offer for free! If a room is not ready for early check-in, that's perfectly understandable; but how is it fair to say your room is ready but if you don't wait around until 4pm, you have to pay extra? This isn't some kind of pay-by-the-hour flophouse! If you get a good deal on the price, I would recommend the Intercontinental. I feel kind of bad about being so negative because none of the staff provided any bad service, nor were the facilities below standard. I just feel that in a 4 or 5-star hotel, you expect to be encouraged to approach the staff, to make any requests that you need, and that the establishment should try to accommodate these out of goodwill to enhance your stay as a valued guest. By the end of my stay, I felt like it wasn't even worth asking for anything because I'd just have to pony up, or feel embarrassed to decline because of the fees. If you stay here, you will not be disappointed by the staff or the hotel â€“ just expect to add an extra 20% or so to your quoted rate, so you don't feel disappointed by that part either.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but nothing special, and don't expect anyone to be friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Southern_Maam
Reviews.Content: The room has nice amenities. I liked the separate shower and bathtub and the big screen TV. The sheets and towels were in the high quality category but nothing special, the bath amenities were similarly high quality but nothing special, the staff were professional but nothing special, room service was good (for room service) but nothing special. "Acceptable but nothing special" describes the entire hotel, which is why the best adjective I can come up with is "nice". The waiting times at reception were very long, and there never seemed to be enough help. When I checked in, the receptionist spent a solid minute explaining how the mini bar could not be tricked, as it had a computerized system with various failsafes built in. For instance, keeping the door of the minibar open for more than one minute would cause you to be charged. Needless to say, I did not feel like a welcome guest, nor did I use the minibar the entire time I was there. The staff was professional, but the amount of friendliness I experienced was directly proportional to the amount they thought I would tip. I usually tip quite well - especially for a place like Montreal, where tipping seems to be on the low 15%-ish side. Only what I consider a quite generous tip would generate any sort of genuine thanks - well, faux genuine - let's say, they put some effort into their thanks. I wasn't inspired to do that many times, only a few when I did ask for something I would consider "extra". This illustrates the entire staff's attitude: I called reception the day before arrival to let them know what time our flight would be landing, and asked if they could try to have our rooms ready around 1pm (2 hours before regular check-in time). The manager's response was that for $25 per room (and we had 7 rooms) he could guarantee early check-in. I asked him if he could just be aware and _try_, and he replied that no, he could not, but that for $25 per room he could guarantee it. (Other members of our group on the same flight were staying at 3 other nearby hotels, and those hotels all agreed, with no problem, to help us with early check-in - and they provided it, too.) There were 2 better-than-blah experiences. One: I had one excellent room service meal, but only because I stopped by the restaurant and ordered from the chef's daily specials, instead of using the room service menu. Two: I received excellent service from the concierge, who I noticed wore the keys of a professional concierge on his collar. I expect his professional "friendliness" was more the result of his professional training, and less the result of the influence of the hotel. Only a highly conscientious professional could keep from showing their cynicism in such a working environment. I'm not giving perfect marks on cleanliness, because one of my drawers had pastry crumbs and a bakery bag left in it; and, because the pool tiles needed to be cleaned, although the water seemed well-maintained. However, I do believe that the room was generally cleaned well. I am recommending this hotel, with the above caveats, because (1) you do get exactly what you pay for - no more, but no less, either - and (2) it is directly across the street from the Palais des Congres conference center, and that is a wonderful thing if you're at a conference. If you're not at a conference, there is absolutely no reason to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel, interesting area...”
Reviews.Author: StamfordRaffles
Reviews.Content: Loved Montreal, although most of the people there kept telling me Quebec was more beautiful! Stayed in a club room at the top of the hotel and the room was large, the hotel quiet and the service good. The only oddity was the club lounge was on the ground floor, behind a glass door that other guests kept knocking on, because they didn't know what the room was and how to get it. The staff in the club lounge were great and kept the coffee coming and topped up drinks before tidying away for the night. Hotel is practically in the main conference centre and is within easy walking area of the old city with its cafes and bars and restaurants. Much of Monteal seems to be covered areas and underground malls and walkways. (Kind of like Singapore, but expecting snow...) but it's worth getting out and maybe walking up to the park if work allows.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated, great city location!”
Reviews.Author: diggcm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in early Novemebr, and really enjoyed our stay! It is located on the edge of Old Montreal and central to most things and close to the Metro. It was a fairly short walk to St. Catherine Street for those who like to shop! The room was quite nice and roomy, the decor was lovely. We ate at their restaurant Osco one evening and also had a drink at their Absinthe bar. Sarah. B. The staff were friendly and helpful! We did have to call 2 days in a row for more than one face cloth. High speed internet was $15 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly place”
Reviews.Author: javl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days to attend a conference. The rooms are beautiful--recently renovated, very well laid out, huge marble bathrooms, comfortable beds. I was given a corner room, which was very nice. Never heard a sound from other guests. Every single staff member I encountered was very friendly. They generously let me stumble along in French, and they moved with ease between French and English. I ate dinner there the first night, and it was delicious--the scallops were especially good. The breakfast buffet was relatively modest--but in a way I liked. Most hotel buffets are too excessive. This one has just what you need--with wonderful, fresh ingredients for omelettes, which were beautifully prepared. The location was perfect for a conference, since it was just across the street from the Palais des Congres, but also close to Old Montreal. I would definitely stay there with my family. My only complaint is one that applies to most big chain, high cost hotels: 14.99/day for wireless is outrageous. You'd earn so much more loyalty if you simply made it free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: AlexMove
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great location. From arrival in our car to departure, the whole stay was wonderful. Check in was effortless, the bags arrived in our room very quickly and the car was ready out front as soon as we had called for it. Lady concierge was wonderful - so helpful. The decor was lovely with fine attention to detail. The carpets, cushions and pillows made a warm but plush atmosphere. All good. Would definately stay there again - no problem.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star at a three star price!”
Reviews.Author: budahhfly
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how wonderful Intercontinental Hotel in Montreal was for our stay. I booked a double room, traveling with my husband, Mom and two yorkies. The room was large and the bathroom was very spacious. The furnishings were modern and very comfy. The room was well appointed with all the neccesities. The service was fantastic, from the front desk, valet parking, room service, concierge to housekeeping. Everyone was pleasant, gracious and very helpful. They even sent a cake for My mother as we were celebrating her birthday. I'm not sure how they even knew! Would reccomend this hotel a million times.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect Experience at the Intercontinental Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lytton42
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time over two nights at the Intercontinental Montreal. The public spaces are understated and very stylish, and the staff are professional and friendly. I was upgraded to a turret room with excellent views north and west, though there are those spiders outside the windows that many others have mentioned. A couple of problems were taken care of very quickly: wine that I ordered wasn't available, but I was given something more expensive and very good instead, and at the original price. There was also a problem with my TV, but a very nice repairman visited my room quickly and took care of things. The location is excellent for those interested in seeing Old Montreal or doing shopping in the city centre; both are just a few blocks away. The rates are quite reasonable given the elegance of the hotel. I will stay here again when I return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Had the pleasure of experiencing the Intercontinental!”
Reviews.Author: sherrymac62
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Intercontinental this past weekend. I had brought my mother to montreal for a day of shopping and a great supper out. Our room was recently renovated and beautifully decorated. Great beds and linens. Many business people there so I assume that they find it a good experience also. Bathrooms are large and the shower is separate from the bathtub. Service at the front desk and from the bellmen was excellent. Had the brunch the next morning and it was very good and fresh, lovely smoked salmon. Only complaint that I had was the service from one of the waitresses in the bar left a lot to be desired. Wasn't that busy there late at night and it took quite a while to get served and have her come back to see if we wanted anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Schimizz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the advice of our friend Linda K., and travelled to Montreal for a long weekend. Linda recommended the InterContinental, and we are glad she did. The hotel is modern, clean, and in a great location. Chantel, their concierge, is very nice and knows all of the best restaurants to dine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to everything - ideal for either business or pleasure trip.”
Reviews.Author: Family_Of_Four_05
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our 3 day stay at the InterContinental in Montreal. Excellent rooms, a great hotel restaurant (the breakfast buffet was a great chance to introduce the kids to French pastries and cooking) and very good service from every member of the staff. We give them extra credit for the well-appointed bathroom and big flat-screen TV. One small suggestion â€“ use the valet parking service, since the parking spots reserved for the public are on levels 9-12 in the underground garage! Itâ€™s a really long trip down to get to them, plus we had to take no less than 3 different elevators to get from our room to the car. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Up to the marque”
Reviews.Author: MCBDurham
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental Montreal with my wife and two teenage girls. I booked two Club rooms via the hotel website at a cost of CAD 235.00 each per night. The hotel location was excellent, being close to the 'night scene' restaurants and harbour front, though upon arrival you may feel that you are being greeted at the rear of the hotel. Upon arrival the valet attendant took charge of both our car and luggage, and we were directed upstairs (via an escalator) to a seamless check in experience. Rooms were allocated on the 24th floor, and luggage delivery was prompt. The views from the Club floor were excellent, and the lounge a quiet haven for breakfast and afternoon drinks. Service throughout was professional and courteous, and the recent renovations of a very high standard. A special thanks to the staff at reception, and the lady in the Club lounge who always wore a smile.
